I'm sure the high shutter speed and pixel density wouldn't make as great an impression on someone whose camera is only 2-3 years old.  And I don't doubt that there are better units out there than the Z915 to be had for not many more bucks than we spent.  Having used a DSLR for a whole vacation, I can tell you that for your average user, this camera will bring you about as close as any non-professional or serious hobbyist really needs.  The image stabilization is really quite incredible; the photos I took from the upper deck of a moving ferry to Mackinac Island on a blustery day were gorgeous.  I leaned towards this unit because of Kodak's reputation for punchy colors, and I wasn't disappointed.  It does veer a little close to looking surreal, but the photos I took of the gardens of Lincoln Park Zoo in Chicago and on New York City's High Line Park are rich and varied.  That caters to my tastes, and I won't apologize for it.  All the other little things are there - a pretty intelligent automatic setting, nice scene settings for everything from close-ups and portraits to landscapes and sunsets, 10x zoom, fast transfers to your home computer.  You know the drill.  It covers everything quite well.  And let's be realistic, people, as much as the camera companies are trying to guilt you into moving on from your older cameras with newer models sporting 12 MP, nobody needs that many.  Heck, most of us don't need 10 MP.  In fact, on the hunt that eventually resulted in my buying the Kodak Z915, I limited my search to cameras between 7 and 10 MPComplaints about the design and build are not entirely out of line.  The plastic does feel a touch on the cheap side.  I'm not opposed to having a camera that evokes the feel of the simple pocket cameras of my youth, but still this does have a toyish feel.  And the screen-only viewfinder is a bit frustrating when reviewing the photos you've taken.  Even my old Nikon felt like it gave me a better idea about the quality of the photos on the card.  That's just a word of warning - this camera takes BEAUTIFUL pictures, but you won't appreciate them at all until you've seen them on your home computer or printed them out.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Beginning Hobbyist Who Wants to Learn More
Reviews.Author: Linda S. Keiles
Reviews.Content: I never buy anything without researching, especially when it comes to electronics. After over a month of reading reviews and comparison shopping, I decided that the Kodak EasyShare Z915 was the right camera for my needs. I am a very amateur photographer, but I have aspirations of one day being more of a serious hobbyist. I could not afford digital DSL, but wanted more than a point and shoot. I wanted to be able to learn and experiment with the mysteries of aperture, white balance and more, along with a strong zoom lens. After less than two months of playing, I'm by no means a much better photographer, but I sure am having a great time learning! My understanding of basic photographic concepts is increasing, I feel free to experiment, and my wallet isn't much lighter than it would have been had I bought grande lattes for a month straight! Great camera for the beginning hobbyist who wants to learn. Only con so far...can't stand the Kodak software, but when I tried to disable, I had a difficult time downloading from camera. I know there's a trick, but I haven't quite figured it out yet. If someone out there has, would love to know!

Reviews.Title: Pleased with product.
Reviews.Author: Sheila E.Rogenmuser
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine, nice size. Issue: Having problems with compatability of Kodak Easy Share with Windows 7 Home Premium.  Still working on it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Diana Kinkade
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera for the price.  Love having the video capability.  Easy to use and download.  Takes great pictures.  I'm sure I haven't discovered all it can do!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca C. Pitt
Reviews.Content: Wow! I just got my camera in today and I am just blown away. The size if perfect; it's small enough to take anywhere, but not so small you think you'll break it, and big enough so you can see the pictures you've taken very clearly. The picture quality is amazing. While you're focusing on what you're about to capture, the screen is a tad grainy, but you can still see the image clearly, and the graininess doesn't transfer onto the captured image. It even has a panorama option, which I wasn't aware of, but am very happy to discover. I completely recommend this camera to anyone. It's so easy to figure out and simple to use, but still has a wide variety of options for picture taking. You really can't beat the price either, I've shopped around for almost a year, and can't find anything with as many qualities as this for the price.

Reviews.Title: Quality and simplicity
Reviews.Author: ArtWork "ArtWork"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased cameras in the past that were not user friendly or rather,because I was camera illiterate. I went to Vegas with my wife for the first time and wanted a camera that was inexpensive,easy to use, and took great pictures.The Kodak Z915 is that camera!Take it from me! My Las Vegas pictures came out so clear that they were mistaken for post cards!So easy to use and focus and the video footage was also crisp and clear. The Z915 looks handsome and is well made. I love this camera.After viewing the pictures, many of my friends and family members now want one of their own.Buy the Kodak Z915, you'll be happy you did!

Reviews.Title: Easy share Z915
Reviews.Author: Charles M. Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I Got this camera on Dec 5, Took pictures of the Christmas parade on Dec 6, I have never had a digital camera before. It was my first experience with one And it worked just fine, Took some great pictures. I haven't had any problems with it at all. I love it. Would like to than Amazon for their great service too..

Reviews.Title: Best little camera I ever owned
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Wroblewski
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. When buying look for Optical Zoom over Digital Zoom for better picture taking.This camera has 10x Optical zoom. Takes the best pictures. And I have 2 grand childrenunder age 2, so it takes pictures really fast. If you just click it intothe correct picture mode it snaps picture after picture. I would recommendthis camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: VERY NICE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: CBT
Reviews.Content: The camera works very well. I have only had it a short time, but I really like it. Comfortable to hold.  Excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last
Reviews.Author: efells
Reviews.Content: I bought this eighteen months ago. I used it infrequently. I don't remember dropping it or subjecting it to other use than around the house and yard. It took good pictures and video. It was easy to use out of the box. I liked the fact that it used AA batteries. The battery charge lasted long enough for my use.It began to fall apart with minimal use. First the USB connection broke. The small tongue-like piece inside of the camera that the USB plug surrounds came out with the USB cable. This made the USB cable unusable. The work around is to to take the SD card out and plug it into the card reader on the PC. I think the frequent opening and closing of the battery case where the SD card sets eventually led to misalignment of the case in regards to the lens. Now the lens won't open when I turn the unit on. For the price I expected a lot longer life. The unit did not hold up to moderate use.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Derricka Hawout
Reviews.Content: I am not a photographer, I am a Mom!  I want to be able to take nice pics of my kids to share and to keep.  This camera has met my needs!  This camera has always taken very nice pictures.  It is very easy to operate, even for someone who doesn't know much about cameras.  And it has some very nice features.  We loved the panoramic option when we went to the Grand Canyon, and I love the sports option when taking pictures of my son playing football.  There are night options, and day options, and bright sun options which are great at the beach.  This has been a very versatile camera, easy to use, and durable, as I have been using it for over two years and I still love it!

Reviews.Title: A great camera.
Reviews.Author: Ash "Ashley"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few years.I am happy with it.  I've taken some excellent pictures with it.  I love the 10X zoom, but am now looking into getting something -- possibly another Kodak -- with a 20X+ zoom.  I adore taking close-up pictures of things, and while this camera can do close-ups, the close-up pictures don't always come out looking great.  Sometimes, you get lucky and they do come out great, but I want something that can get very, very close-up pictures without really having to work at it.Otherwise, this is a really great camera and I've not really had any problems with it.  I'm just "growing out of it" if you want to call it that.  I am ready for something a little better--or more professional.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Kodak Product
Reviews.Author: bertwest
Reviews.Content: First, let me state that I did not purchase this product from Amazon. Now, let me say that the image quality of this camera is the worst. Initially, I had a focus problem - and had to send it to Kodak repair(what a joke) twice to "repair" that problem. Each time that cost me at least $10. The image is "thin", meaning that it has no "body" or depth that can be manipulated with a image editor except in the slightest(and I do mean slightest) way. When enlarging or cropping an image you will see the noise and the "blotchy" way that the picture and color are constructed. This is the noisiest camera I have ever used - second to none. I previously purchased a Kodak CX7530 and it was by far a better camera with a much better image, with only 5MP. It had a CCD sensor, the Z915 has a cheap CMOS, which is truely inferior in every way - there is no way the Z915 is an upgrade even though it boasts 10MP. The last time I was on the phone to Kodak "customer no service" for over 40 minutes - and they told me that my problems would all be solved if I set the dial to the choice with the red lettering - what a waste of my time. After using Kodak products for over 40 years, I will definitively state that this is the last Kodak product I will ever buy......No wonder they are in bankruptcy.

Reviews.Title: Great Video capability
Reviews.Author: JimmyK
Reviews.Content: I've had my Z915 over a year and it's never let me down.  I shoot a lot of videos at local Karaoke venues and the Kodak has extremely clear resolution and great audio reception.  I've posted approx 60 videos on YouTube shot with the Z915, both in the home "studio" and at the venues.  The only (minor) drawback is that in a low light situation it won't take a good. clean shot (in video).  Low light in the still mode is very good as the flash unit has a fairly long reach.  One of the best low priced cameras around.  I especially like the AA battery feature and highly recommend the Energizer Lithium batteries.  They last for over 150 still shots or 8 to 10 + videos.Jimmy K - Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: Blurry, grainy pics
Reviews.Author: Mom of twins
Reviews.Content: I bought this after my girls let my 2 year old niece play with my old camera.  (On a side note, I wish I just bought the same exact one- it was a Canon and now I can't remember which one unfortunately.  It was under $100 and took the BEST pics ever.  I had a cashier double check that the photo I was making copies of wasn't a professional one.  I could kick myself!) I saw the reviews of this and the great price and ordered it.  It started out ok, took decent pics, but it seems the more pics I take, the worse they look.  I've read directions, tried all different modes, changed batteries, etc. and they still suck.  They are blurry, too yellow or dark and the flash is slow as well.  Battery life is terrible, This is the worst Christmas photo card year b/c I have no decent pics to use.  I'm giving it to my daughters to play around with and buying a Canon.  Don't buy!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z915 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Compact enough to take anywhere, takes excellent pictures,I have taken thousands of pictures since i got it, and have never been unhappy. The panoramic feature takes beautiful panoramic shots and even helps stitch them better if you are off a little bit. Great camera for a great price. But it was only 121.00 at the time i bought it new. I would still buy it for the price it is now though, knowing the camera. i dont have any problems with the software it comes with, some people say they dont like it, its fine for me. I am not a professional photographer but i live in a beautiful state and use this camera several times a week.

Reviews.Title: Wish it had lasted a full year
Reviews.Author: Melanie Harvey
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera, but the flash quit working in about 9 months. Unfortunately, I received as a gift and don't have a receipt-- WARNING: Kodak does not honor warranties without a receipt.Now, I have a daylight camera with no flash. I will not every buy another Kodak product because of this.

Reviews.Title: Have had this camera appox. 6 months now
Reviews.Author: maod
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best camera (AND TAKES THE BEST PICTURES) that I have ever owned.  The pictures are so crisp and sharp, with beautiful vivid color ....very very impressed!  I like to think of myself as a frugal person ......that buys quality items, but not pay full price, (of course I got a good deal on this), but have to say even the full price on this camera would have been worth it.  It is very simple to use ......for us older folk (well, not that ancient).....lol ..  I reluctantly let my son take it to Paris yesterday .....as I was going to use it for my trip to Ohio ....but ....I think Paris will provide more interesting pictures ......just wish I could be going with him!  Darn .......

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!
Reviews.Author: Frequent Clicker
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera!  It takes pictures fairly quickly, which was important to me.  I love being able to zoom in on things that would otherwise look very far away.  There are sometimes blurry pictures, but I think that's expected with a toddler running or jumping up and down.  Sometimes, though, it will catch him in motion and look GREAT!  I have bought rechargeable batteries to use and am very glad to have this camera.

Reviews.Title: Finally, a user friendly camera
Reviews.Author: T. Skaggs "RedThom"
Reviews.Content: After numerous attempts, I have finally found a user friendly digital camera in the Kodak EasyShare Z915.  Menus are easy to read and instructions easy to follow.  I have picture quality excellent and controls are also user friendly.  Of the four digital cameras I have owned, it is by far my favorite and I look forward to  having it for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera Kit for a Great Price
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera every day since I got it in the mail. I stopped photography as a hobby a few years ago, and the Z915 has made it easy and fun to jump back in. 10MP and 10x optical zoom are the highlights.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Alvaro N
Reviews.Content: its like a pro cam but cheap , the whole package it comes with is just excellent, the batteries,the charger for them and the camera, great one, good pics, lots of features, EXCELLENT image qualitygo ahead buy it!

Reviews.Title: best travel camera
Reviews.Author: MARY L NOLAN
Reviews.Content: i purchased this camera over a year ago for an african safari. the pictures i captured actually won me a photo contest. after some of the others travelling with me viewed my photos they put their cameras down and purchased a copy from me. another girl had a slr camera. she couldn't capture half of what i did as the animals would move before she could adjust her camera. putting it on sport for moving animals worked best for me. if you edit your photos including cropping on the camera, then upload to the kodak software, you can zoom even deeper with awesome results. the only downside is that it will overheat on you in certain conditions and stop working. also one point i must add,,,with this hd camera you will get even better pictures using the hd sim card!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: fess
Reviews.Content: so far so good, pictures look great. zoom is great. i would recommend this camera to the average picture taker. we have only had it for about a month, but use about every day and only had to charge the battery 2 times.

Reviews.Title: Awesome value!
Reviews.Author: Barb M
Reviews.Content: I shopped around a lot before buying this camera - my original thought was that I'd get this one because it's what I could afford now; then I'd get a better one later.  But I'm so happy with this one I may not ever trade up.The zoom is enormous (10X) for a camera of this type.  I took a lot of pictures at an indoor swim meet on "no flash" and they turned out great.  One of my big concerns is shutter lag and I don't notice any at all with this camera: it takes great action shots.  It has "image stabilization" and I think that helps, too.  It's a little slower (a few seconds) than my previous Panasonic to initially turn on; but once it's on it recycles quickly.I specifically chose this model because it takes AA batteries so I don't have to worry about being out camping with no power to recharge a proprietary battery, e.g., or having it die on me.  I use rechargeables and they seem to last a long time; but I also carry around a couple of Alkaline spares "just in case."I didn't realize before I bought it that this camera also has a totally manual setting.  If I understood what I was doing, I could set the aperture, shutter, iso, etc. individually.  That gives me some motivation to learn more.  But the "Smart" setting - letting the camera choose - has really been great.  I've also tried the sports, sunset and low light settings so far with terrific results.  I have had fun playing with the Panorama setting (new to me - it "stitches" 2 or 3 pictures to yield one wide one) and I think the "Manners" setting (for museums or other environments where you don't want flash or sounds) is also a great idea, too.  I like that a quick explanation comes up on the screen so I can quickly flip through the icons to find what I want.  The screen is surprisingly visible even in bright sun - that was a pleasant change from just having to "guess" whenever I was in the sun.Moving from a Panasonic to a Kodak means, after only 6 weeks, I'm still in the learning curve but I am extremely happy with the pictures and ease of use of this camera.  It's a little large compared to the very compact ones that are out now, but it has a nice feel in my hand; it still fits nicely in a jacket or sweater pocket and I happily traded the slightly larger size for the convenience of the AA batteries and the ease of handling.I have not used the software at all yet - I know that "old" Kodak software was awful but I can't speak to the new versions.  I just remove the SD card and pop it in my card reader so I haven't even installed the software that came with it.  I know that there is a certain amount of editing I can do right on the camera, but I haven't tried that yet either.So far I have no regrets and I am totally impressed with how much camera I got for such a reasonable cost!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera/Video Recorder at decent price
Reviews.Author: Garry Engelberg
Reviews.Content: Excellent price for a  decent camera, not one a pro would use I'm sure but for me it is trul;y wonderful

Reviews.Title: Great camera; great price.
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Widman
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law who is a professional photographer told me about this camera.  It is a 10 megapixal and 10 x zoom.  When I opened it, it did not appear to be a quality camera, it was plastic. However, it has taken great pictures.  I go to alot of sporting events for nieces and nephew and I've taken great shots of my nephew on the football field in the daylight.  Nighttime pictures on the field don't turn out too great, but I wouldn't expect them to.For $99 for the battery charger, camera, and case, this is a great deal.  I'm really glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased...
Reviews.Author: Ms. SIlly Goose ":)"
Reviews.Content: We bought this item as a gift from our entire team for one of teammates leaving the company. It was a fabulous price and it was delivered super fast and in great condition! Excellent Service!!

Reviews.Title: awesome camera, awesome price.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!!! it's kodak, so it's easy to use, of course. you can adjust the aperature and the shutter speed easily. it's good quality for a great price... i bought this with my own babysitting money so i was lucky to find a nice one for not too expensive. i would reccomend it to any 10- 12 year old photographers like me, as well as any adult photographers. i outgrew my kodak md41 too fast and i expect for this one to last a long time. i wish that the card slot was not right next to the batteries, though. the door to the batteries/card feels cheap like you could break it off too easily. so to upload it, i use the chord when i would like to use the card. great camera!

Reviews.Title: Awesome ....
Reviews.Author: Tinku
Reviews.Content: This is just wonderful camera for me. Before I purchase this Z915 camera I read a lot about it. And I find out this z915 is above my expectation level.It's very easy for them who only can press the shutter button to take picture with "smart capture mode".There is also very advance level feature in this Z915 camera. This camera is very much user friendly, you can read instruction which one u want to know while u take picture.

Reviews.Title: good enough for my needs
Reviews.Author: Leo E. Dolloff
Reviews.Content: I take pictures about 6 times a year.I don't need a high end camera,I don't want to impress anyoneI bought it for me.Pictures were good quality,battery life a little short.I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Deal
Reviews.Author: ferminjcr
Reviews.Content: I'm really satisfied with this camera, it have a lot of functions to make your photos look amazing, the charger is fine but it get really hot. overall this is a great camera for a great price

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gail in Branson
Reviews.Content: Although not an expensive camera, it is an easy camera to operate, even for novice photographers, like myself.  It takes great pictures and is more camera than I actually expected!  I would recommend this product to any one.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share Z915
Reviews.Author: Grandma "future GNP"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  We recently took it on vacation and the picture quality and ease of use was excellent.  It is a little bulkier than your modern cameras but with 10x zoom it makes it well worth the little extra effort it takes to carry it around!  My only complaint is the first week I used it on vacation I had the strap included attached to the camera and it broke and my camera fell onto a parking lot.  It did not damage the camera other than a few scratches and the picture quality still was excellent but I thought the strap should have been adequate for the camera.  I got this camera on sale for about $100 and it was really a great deal!  It probably doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the smaller, more popular cameras, but I find you can edit any picture on a computer program anyway so I really didn't look for those features.  This was a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Bundle for Price
Reviews.Author: David Bradshaw
Reviews.Content: The camera is great and the bundle is a great purchase.  The camera takes beautiful pictures, and the shutter speed is super fast!  Flash is great and can take a lot of pictures on one battery life.  The bundle includes a case (which fits the camera perfectly and is Kodak branded), a travel battery charger (also Kodak brand) with two rechargeable batteries.  The pictures are easy to take and the camera has a description of each setting so you do not have to keep looking for symbols and there meanings.  The panoramic picture is great as well and easy to use with line up imagery to make the picture seamless.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Carole
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived a week earlier then was promised--good deal.  Everything was as promised.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EashShare Z915
Reviews.Author: Martha Craner "Martha C"
Reviews.Content: I love the ease of the Kodak EasyShare, and particularly love the 10X zoom.  Now I can get those far away details that I was missing!

Reviews.Title: I upgraded from my old EasyShare to this one and I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: cm "His servant"
Reviews.Content: The zoom is great and very detailed.  It is so easy to use and takes very sharp, clear pictures.  I wish I had bought it a month ago before I went on a mission trip to Nicaragua.  I had my old EasyShare which took great pics but this one is much better!

Reviews.Title: Pleased with my choice.
Reviews.Author: Big Al Kirkland
Reviews.Content: Very easy to pick up and start using without having to go through a lot of instructions.  The video function worked great for my niece's baptism-good video and audio quality.

Reviews.Title: Babies are breath taking.
Reviews.Author: Rose
Reviews.Content: I have grand children from ages 2 to 25 and 2 great grand sons under a year old. I take a lot of pictures.  I like this camera because it is easy to focuse and the sutter time is fast. Babies won't keep a smile or be still long at a time.  I sit ready to grab the camera and take pictures when thsy come in.  I always get beautiful shots. The color is good, the picture is clear, and I like the face finders to line up  the shots.  I think the money was well spent.Kodak EasyShare Z915 Digital Camera (Black)

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: eeb
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera to take family pictures on a vacation and received many compliments and requests for copies.  Others in my family have much more expensive cameras but the picture quality of this camera exceeded theirs.  The videos came out great as well, some were taken on a moving boat and didn't blur, pictures were crisp and clear. Great buy for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: PK
Reviews.Content: I have a couple of Digital Pocket Cameras that have 4 & 7 Mega pixels and 3x zooms. They both work good so I wasn't in the market for a new camera, unless a great deal came along.If I was to get a new camera it would have to be one with more zoom without spending $200+. I found a deal on the Kodak Z915 - it was $105.00 which included a $25.00 gift card. (Pretty Cheap!) It was actually cheaper than either of my current cameras.Because it actually cost less than the cameras I have now I wanted to do a comparison.I took a dozen indoor pictures with each camera from the same spot. All the cameras were set to "AUTO" mode and all the pictures were printed out at a Photo Kiosk.The Kodak Z915 produced good pictures, some of the pictures from my old cameras came out better, because the Kodak Smart Capture Feature on the Z915 made some of the pictures yellowish or had over processed colors. I found that by switching the Kodak Z915 to the "P" mode and re-taking the yellowish pictures they came out as good as my old cameras.All the indoor zoomed pictures with the Kodak Z915 came out really nice. The zoomed pictures with my old cameras had a more grainy look. The Kodak Z915 must have a more powerful flash or better lens quality.The outdoor pictures with the Kodak Z915 came out really nice. The colors were reproduced very closely to the original,(set in "P" mode). Colors with my old cameras come out darker, not the same shade as the original.The zoom on this camera is REALLY nice, at full optical zoom there is good detail to the pictures. This was the main reason for getting this camera in the first place. Sometimes you just cant get close to the subject and having a 10x zoom will let you do this.Other notes:The Kodak Z915 uses two "AA" batteries. I use NIMH rechargeable ones that last for many pictures. This is nice because my other cameras have proprietary LION batteries that are expensive and require special chargers or cables connected to the camera to charge up. You can find "AA" batteries anywhere.The camera comes with Kodak's Easy Share Software. I never liked it and don't use it. There are better programs available, some for free.Overall I am happy with the Kodak Z915. It provided me with some pictures already that I would not of had with my old cameras! Without spending $200.00+I will still use my old cameras around the house or at the beach or amusement park, but if I'm going to a concert or family event the Kodak Z915 will be by my side!

Reviews.Title: Great features, not as nice construction.
Reviews.Author: digems
Reviews.Content: For $129.00, you can't beat the feature set included in this camera.  Great zoom and color in the pictures.  The worst problem I've had is the lag time between depressing the button and it taking the picture in the automatic mode.  I have had great luck with Kodak cameras (except my last one was stolen with a year's worth of pictures in it still).

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D. Patten "JP"
Reviews.Content: Ordered product arrived new in package and works well. Arrived in promised amount of time.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Paul T. S. "PTS"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera with lots of options. Simple to use and captures excellent pictures.  The optical 10X zoom is great.  Excellent product for the money.  I think this is the best deal on a camera out there !!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Everyday Users but not for Pros
Reviews.Author: H. Duah "dherbsta"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for 100 dollars refurbished so it included one year warranty. I will describe myself as a beginner photographer since I am in high school. I just needed the cheapest camera with Manual Control. I was soo excited to get the camera but when i got it, I was a bit bummed. The screen quality on the camera was horrible. But it pictures were great on the computer. One thing that made me want to throw the camera to the wall was the MACRO. This is camera has the worst Macro ever so if you shoot pictures with macro. Dont buy. Macro is when you should close up objects. Other than that it is a great camera. Especially for families. Zoom is super and auto mode is okay. But unfortunatelly my LCD screen cracked from the inside after buying it. It was in a case in my backpack. So I sent it in repair. I was able to give the camera a 4 star review even though the screen cracked. That shows how much I liked it. Dont buy the camera if it is over $160 though. Way much better Nikons and Canons with the same and better features.Kodak EasyShare Z915 Digital Camera (Black)

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Donna M. Ferguson "Koala60"
Reviews.Content: Arrived just as promised and packaged very securely. Camera is easy to use and the pictures are great!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica Fangmeyer
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, several settings.  Like that it uses rechargable batteries or regular AA batteries.  Good zoom features.

Reviews.Title: kodak z915
Reviews.Author: Lynn Widner
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera after doing some research. First digital camera ever owned besides my cell phone. Love all the features, although don't know how to use some because just not that camera savvy. Have used it to do some pics & videos around the house, but the big event is at end of March. Love how clear the pics have come out, video is slightly choppy but not bad for not being a video camera. Price was awesome!! Speed of delivery was great, had within a week of order!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Suiter
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price.  Easy to use features. Ease of moving pictures and video to computer or picture frames. Recommended to buy.

Reviews.Title: Z915 Camera
Reviews.Author: Berry Farm
Reviews.Content: Manuel is a general manuel for many models and not specific to Z915.  Have to use internet to look up directions.  Camera will do a lot of things if you can find and understand the directions.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have had til it broke
Reviews.Author: R. perisian "Rogerslake"
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was holding this camera up to some pretty high standards. Seams like my past 2 cameras, didn't have the colors right. So I took this little gem to S.F. with me for the weekend, and took 267 pictures. I took some awesome pics of the goldengate bridge. Some great shots of the city. But the greatest test was when I took it to the Raider game, and shot some pics from the top level with the 10X zoom. I got pics of the kickoff and they were very clear and sharp too. considering the speed at what the players were moving. I used the video during the game to record Bushes touchdown, and it was just like watching it on t.v. Only problem I see is when I am trying to adjust the soom when shooting video, the focus goes in and out. hoping there is a way to fix this, cause this camera is awesome. HAD FOR ONLY 3 WEEKS AND THE LENS COVER FROZE UP AND WON'T OPEN ALL THE WAY. NOTHING BUT JUNK NOW. GETTING A REFUND RIGHT NOW.

Reviews.Title: Quite pleased....
Reviews.Author: Derek R. Burton
Reviews.Content: At the price point I purchased it, this is an excellent little camera.  If I could change one thing it would be the size.  I'd actually like it to be a little larger and easier to hold.  My first long use session was outdoors and it was cold; any small frame device with close set buttons is more difficult in that setting.  But otherwise a great little camera...now that Kodak "easyshare" software is another story.  I uninstalled that 2 days after loading it.Derek

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z915 10 x digital zoom
Reviews.Author: Charmaine J. Reid "Newlisbon"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera with easy operation can always depend on a Kodak to perform well. We tried out several in store before deciding to purchase this one.  It replaces an old Kodak that we used for 10 years.

Reviews.Title: disappointment
Reviews.Author: Nicholas L. Prince "pagan420"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera prior to a trip to the UK...tried it out at home and had no problems...took tons of pics on my trip...got home, downloaded them and found 50% of the point-n-shoot pics were out of focus...the zoom shots turned out great...huge disappointment to see so many pics ruined by a faulty camera...plus, there was problems with the easyshare software, had to take a 4G card to Wal-Mart to get picture discs made due to inability to download straight to my laptop..have used Olympus and Canon cameras & software with no problems at all....these brands have fantastic point-n-shoot cameras...Kodak will never see my business again...buy this camera if you want to be disappointed with your vacation pics.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: AF Mom "AF Mom"
Reviews.Content: Received this camera and I love it!  It takes great pictures the zoom is amazing for a point and click.  This is the 3rd Kodak Digital Camera I have owned and you can't go wrong with Kodak!

Reviews.Title: I REALLY wanted to like this camera
Reviews.Author: Johnny Appleseed
Reviews.Content: My wife was going to Miami to see her aunt and wanted a camera to take down.  Our older Kodak had recently broken.  I researched the newer Kodaks and was set on the z915 . . . 10MP, 10X zoom, just the camera I wanted.  ALL of our other Kodak digitals (3 total) had been great and taken fantastic pictures.  Alas, that was not the case with this camera.  All of the shots were fuzzy.  My camera wise daughter pointed out to her older-eyed dad that they just weren't as sharp as they should have been.  Took this camera back to Staples and bought a C190, 12MP, but only a 5x zoom.  However, the picture quality was SHARP and crisp, exactly what we had been used to.  Needless to say, my loving wife took that camera to Florida.

Reviews.Title: pretty good for less than 150
Reviews.Author: jack
Reviews.Content: Pictures are not bad at all. Sure the black areas have quite a bit of noise even in 100ISO, but otherwise colors are pretty even and bright.The zoom works good, it cannot always focus well on far-away objects, but mostly it does. Otherwise You can always focus on a bigger object at the same distance and move the camera towards your subject later.Has just been a few days so cannot comment on how long it will last. Its all plastic, so might feel a bit tacky.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Gabino E. Matus Jr. "Photo Pro"
Reviews.Content: Produces well focused photos about 50% of the time. I can't get it to focus at full zoom.  When the photos are focused, the colors are very crisp.

Reviews.Title: Not a single computer in the house recognizes it to download pics!
Reviews.Author: Absinthe
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our family for X-mas, and so far we are very pleased with the picture quality (much better than our very outdated 8 year old digital camera that was once a good quality camera when we bought it so long ago).This camera takes quite good pictures in a variety of lighting conditions, and is very easy to use.  The zoom capabilities are excellent.  We are also pleased with the fair quality of the videos it takes (considering it is a camera, after all).  If you are looking for professional quality, this camera probably isn't for you, but for regular everyday pictures that most families would want to take, this camera is excellent.The one *major* complaint I have with this camera is that not a single computer in our house recognizes it when we attach it to the USB port (and this is after downloading the driver software that comes with the camera). We tried it on an Acer windows laptop, my older MacBook, my newer MacBook pro, my husband's Dell in windows, my husband's Dell in Linux, our windows desktop, and our linux desktop.  Not once could we get it to recognize the d*mn camera (meanwhile we had a couple of excited kids jumping up and down who could hardly wait to print out a couple of the pictures).  Argghhh!My husband finally went to Walmart and bought a USB card reader, and that works.  We remove the card from the camera, insert it into the reader, and download the pictures that way.When 2 highly educated and very tech-savvy people in the house can't get the camera to connect to any of our large variety of computers, there is something seriously wrong with the driver software.  So, I give the camera itself 5 stars, and the driver software 0 stars.  Try harder next time, Kodak.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my Kodak camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Garcia
Reviews.Content: This is the second camera I bought, the same one. But the second one is for a friend who wants a cheap and a good camera. When you learn to use it you can get Amazing pictures. I post them in my facebook and everyone thinks is a profesional one. Excellent deal!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: fantastic camara
Reviews.Content: i had a Kodak camera I upgraded to this camera it is great. for me it was easy touse, pictures are great,have not use the video yet. The Price is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great camera medium range camera!
Reviews.Author: Sean Whitfield
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted something more than a point and shoot, but wasn't ready to drop the major bucks for a DSLR. This camera is great as it kind of sits right in the middle! The zoom is fantastic! It's probably the best feature on the camera! The screen where you preview your picture could be better, it sometimes makes it look like the pictures came out worse than they did. It takes great nighttime shots! If you have some idea what you are doing, then you can play around with the settings yourself. Otherwise, the automatic functions work just like any other point and shoot.So overall, not the best camera out there, but great for a person who likes to take pictures but would not consider themselves a photographer!

Reviews.Title: More that excellent camera for given price
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: 1. DesignCamera fits in hand very comfortable, easily can be hold by one hand. Design is simple, looks nice, note outfitted or ugly but not glamorous (if someone cares about :)).Plastic body looks very solid, even battery lid (and lid is common weakness of plastic body cameras).It is very compact and not heavy at all. Forget about hesitations like: Should you take your  500g and 500USD camera with you or not. :)2. Battery lifeAA battery is an advantage for me - available everywhere, easy to find, easy to replace. I have used VARTA NiCd rechargeable - about 100 pictures, many with flash, megazoom, up-to 3 short (3-5 min) videos...  With NiMH should perform better.3. LCDSome may say, that 2,5' is small... but it is very bright and vivid display. Even in sunlight you still see, what you shoot - that's very important as no additional viewfinder is available (my advice - keep LCD brightness to 5).4. Performance and shootingKodak Smart Capture generally works well, picture colors are vivid, in-camera processing using Kodak Perfect Touch can also help.  Automatic white balance is also intelligent, but what you may lack - manual WB feature. That's Con.Camera gives no option for JPEG compression you can adjust. It is done automatically. Some may lack that feature for sure.What would make you happy - PASM. Camera gives manual control over aperture, shutter, exposure compensation, flash light compensation. Bracketing function, metering...  But even in manual mode camera suggests best parameters and gives histogram indication in live mode. You can do your own, but non-advanced users may find that very useful. And such suggestions also may help you to understand better how various options may be used best and do reflect on pictures.Camera is fast - quickly turns on and ready to be used, shutter is very fast  as well, but auto focus is bit slow - you may help pressing the shutter slightly, what makes camera to focus.Megazoom, Macro mode and optical stabilization work great. You may get very cool pictures of far-away objects, shooting thru windows or fence (some photos are uploaded to Amazon - please, check).Camera is quite. Makes almost no noise. Very useful for shooting in certain conditions, quiet environment.Flash is also OK (and as said above additional compensation is manually adjustable).  Would enable you to make nice night portraits.5. MenuThis is simply great. Intuitive, easily understandable, gives various hints and explanations... Even if this is your first camera - no chances to be confused or lost.In ConclusionPlease, read features carefully before you make a purchase to know exactly what you would get. From my side I can tell that you definitely get more than enough for this price. Nothing is ideal, but I am not disappointed at all.Should probably add one thing - Camera shots, but that's photograph'r, who makes beautiful pictures. That's why reviews are so different here spreading from 1 to 5 starts. :)

Reviews.Title: A Kodak Moment
Reviews.Author: Pookie
Reviews.Content: Just received the KODAK Z915 (black) today. I have to say, after owning Sony, Canon, and Another Kodak that this was a real surprise. The photos are crystal clear (I have uploaded a photo in the images gallery). The 10x Optical Zoom has exceeded My expectations . Colors are true and bright. The Smart Capture mode works like a dream and it's so easy to take a perfect shot. The VGA Video Quality is also great and almost looks HD . It's safe to say, that I will be sticking with KODAK from now on. I'm a 100% Satisfied Customer :)

Reviews.Title: Loved it so much I bought it twice!
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year ago.  The picture has a great quality.  The sound is so clear during video recording.  I like the smart capture where the camera will adjust to the environment or you can manually adjust for the environment.  I definitely love the 10x zoom.  I used it at a baseball game and the level of detail is extraordinary.  I foster dogs so I post doggie pictures on-line and it's amazing the level of detail you can see on the dogs.I got the camera stolen last Saturday.  I loved it so much that I did not think twice about seeking out the same exact camera to buy again.  It's currently en route and it cannot get here fast enough!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Especially for the Price
Reviews.Author: Penguin Man
Reviews.Content: I personally quite enjoy this camera. I am photographer as a hobby and take several hundred pictures a month. It serves me well.Pros-The 10X zoom is wonderful. I often shoot nature, and it's great to be able to get "close" to whatever you're shooting.- Many of the controls are physical. Meaning, you don't have to dig through a bunch of menus to set up your shot-It's size is quite go for what it can do, it's not going to fit in every pocket, but it's still decently small.- AA batteries are nice instead of a proprietary rechargeable. SD cards are good function too.Cons-Contrary to it's name. I don't find it an "easy-share." as it will only import pictures to it's kodak program. I use my old camera so I can import them without the program.-The flash isn't too great.-I really want a camera with a manual focus, as it can really be a pain to focus on EXACTLY what I want it to, most times it's ok though.-the video is kinda noisy (by noisy, I mean grainy, not loud) at times-the zoom could be faster. It probably takes 5 seconds to zoom all the way in and focusa minor note- the edges of the LCD screen have turned slightly yellow dosen't prevent me from using it at all it just scared me when it first showed upIn terms of value, this is a great buy. If you're going to only be taking pictures of you and your friends or family, good luck finding a quality camera at this price. If you plan to do some serious photography, or lots of video, consider an upgrade

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Edward H. Konetchy "Chow Hound"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after much research. I wanted a camera for my wife and I to use which would be simple to operate and produce godd pictures. We both are completely satisfied with our purchase

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z915: Great little low price camera
Reviews.Author: J. Mcchesney
Reviews.Content: My Canon DSLR camera is a little cumbersome to take on long hikes and back packing trips.So, based on a favorable C-NET review I bought this camera as a part-time substitute for the big camera. WOW! This camera is loaded with features (tons of automatic settings but also allows full manual control). One of the really nice things with the automatic settings is that there are on-screen prompts that tell you what the selected setting does.It comes with an abbreviated users guide with an extended user guide available on-line. I'd recommend reading through the extended users guide. This little camera has just a ton of useful features and I was really surprised when I started to find out everything it will do. If you don't want to read the manual it is easy to just pick it up and start shooting and the photo quality is as good as my D-SLR!It uses AA batteries so you don't have to be close to a wall charger to keep taking pictures. The only view finder is the LCD screen which works well but it is nice to have a Look-through-the-hole type view finder in bright sunshine.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera with good price
Reviews.Author: Larry Comer "film buff"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. I actually selected it from a cnet review. The pictures are crisp and clear, the camera is easy to use. I am an amature so if I can use it, anyone can.  Great buy at a great price.

Reviews.Title: A Bargain at Discount Pricing
Reviews.Author: R. Moore
Reviews.Content: I was shopping for a megazoom or even low-end DSLR camera--but became convinced by the reviews that I should start with a much smaller investment.  Based on the same reviews, I learned that the Z915 was well-regarded as a "large body" but entry-level camera.  Based on having taken and downloaded about 300 pictures, I agree, and am very happy with my choice.My shopping produced a price of $104, delivered, no tax--and for the money, I don't think I could have done better.  The camera has all the essential features that I want to learn and experiment with, and I'll be a much more knowledgeable buyer when I move up to spend 5-10 times as much for a good DSLR.  I haven't yet used the video and sound functions, since I'm waiting for a large-capacity, high-speed storage chip, but expect that they'll be typical of the quality to be expected from low- to mid-range cameras.This camera is very easy to set up and use--the installation software worked like a charm, and I'm impressed by the Kodak customer support and convenience of sharing photographs.  With a 2GB card installed, it has capacity for more than 600 photos, and I like AA batteries; I use rechargeable lithium batteries, and these give me 200+ photo capacity if I don't use the flash too much.Picture quality isn't the best--it doesn't have the name-brand optics that you can find in the $200-$300 range, and it's not a fast optical/electronic combination--but for the money, and at my level of experience, it's certainly good enough for the uses I'll have for this camera.  When displayed on a monitor, vertical/parallel lines look jagged and crude (don't know yet whether this defect is as noticeable when printed at a reasonable size), and there's "noise" (graininess of image) in low-light or magnified pictures.  I gather that these are characteristic of non-DSLR cameras, to some degree, and my expectations weren't great.  If you don't "push" toward the limits, photos taken with the Z915 under ideal or good light/speed conditions are certainly acceptable.It seems to be built pretty solidly--the only concerns I have in this area are the battery/storage card cover, and the flexible "flap" coverings for the USB port and power cord sockets.  The flexible coverings, in particular, are almost certain to part company with the camera (I'll give it a year or so), and the battery cover would be very easy to jam or otherwise mangle and break.  However, I've seen similarly frail-looking closures on higher-priced cameras, so it's probably a common weakness and complaint.As an inexpensive way to start digital photography, I'd recommend this without reservation.

Reviews.Title: the batteries are a p.i.a.
Reviews.Author: A. Hadley
Reviews.Content: IMHO, get the Kodak-Z950.I've had this camera about a month. It comes with alkaline batteries that wear out much too fast. So I started using rechargeable NiMh/2500mAH. Used the camera for about 15 pics and a 2 minute movie,xfered pics, put it away,  Next day took a few pics, then to baby shower, and the batteries were dead.  So three times I have picked up the camera, and after minimal use, the batteries are almost dead.The on/off button and selection wheel are easy to use a big plus. I bought this to replace a dx7440 that broke.  My biggest complaint about that was the on/off selection wheel...that's what finally broke. However, the battery pack was awesome on the dx7440.I haven't tried the Z950, but it looks like the same long lasting battery pack idea that the old dx-cameras had.

Reviews.Title: Kodak has always been my favorite
Reviews.Author: Susan Ewers "Susan Ewers"
Reviews.Content: I got the Kodak Easyshare Z915 for Christmas and I'm so pleased. The quality of the pictures is great. It has so many features and in no time I was using most of them. Kodak quality is the best. I gave my husband my older Kodak camera and it's still going and it's 6 years old. I wanted to update for myself with the latest features on this new one. You won't be disappointed. And as always, Amazon had the best price with all their bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: Nice price, but not worth the trouble...
Reviews.Author: Craig Brousseau
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get a new camera that wouldn't break the bank, SO, when i came across this while searching it had everything i wanted. Upon reading the reviews(most are above 3 stars) I read that it was an easy camera to use, took great pictures, and did more then the "standard" digital camera's did. I also read the negative reviews and they never focused on just 1 area, it was either the focus was poor, battery life was way to short, could break if dropped only a couple on inches. So i bought it, waited my 4 days for it to arrive, i opened it up looked at the directions, put the batteries in, the memory card and turned it on. So i decided to take a picture of my dog so i used the zoom and zoomed in on her, the auto focus wouldn't focus so i reduced the zoom and it would say the same thing. So i snapped a photo and it turned out great! so i quickly went outside to take some pictures of the trees and other things around my yard. About 20-40 pictures later i wanted to review what I had just taken, i pressed the "preview" button on the lower right of the LCD screen... nothing, nothing showed up, just a black screen. The camera was totally unresponsive, I had to take out the double A batteries, put new ones in, turn the power back on and wait for it to reset. Well, i decided to plug it into my computer to see if i could get the pictures off the camera(i didn't need the Kodak easyshare software.) I hooked it up, waited for my computer to read the device and once i was able to view the pictures i was surprised, out of ALL the pictures I had taken, only about 5 actual pictures showed up. Most were blurred, the part I wanted to be focused wasn't crisp and clean, but the background looked nice. About 1 hour later the batteries went dead so i put a new batch in and went to bed. I had some of my relatives come up the next day and I thought I would get a couple pictures of them with the camera, well, of the pictures the camera actually saved, 90% had motion blur, the red eye reduction didn't even work, everything but the person was nice and clear. During the picture taking of my family the camera froze and became unresponsive at least 4 times, maybe 1 out of 10 pictures actually got saved and some of the indoor pictures turned out to dark because the "auto" setting thought it was better to not use flash. all in all, I don't even want to take pictures with this camera. I'm returning it as soon as i can.In 72 hours:7 freezes20 pictures out of 150-200 taken were actually saved to the camera6 AA batteries

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: mamaheel5
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughter, it didn't work, sent it back for a refund. Definitely Would Not Recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Good camera- but beware of batteries
Reviews.Author: rowanne
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few years now- I'll be honest in saying I don't know anything about the technical aspects of cameras, but as far as I'm concerned this is worth the money. It has a bunch of different settings for different scenarios which is nice, and a good zoom feature. I use this for casual photography and it's always produced nice photos as long as you know how to use it. The only con might be deal breaker for a lot of people though: it eats through batteries extremely quickly. As in, if you keep it on it will fully die in 15-20 minutes. We had to get a few pairs of rechargeable batteries just to keep up with it. I'm not sure if this problem is specific to my camera or of all of them but it can definitely get in the way when you're trying to take pictures. Good for casual use, but as I said, I got this a few years ago, so there's probably a lot of other options on the market now for this price range.

Reviews.Title: Gift For Wife
Reviews.Author: Morty
Reviews.Content: My wife absolutely loves this camera. Very easy to operate and maintain. Best price by far was from Amazon..many thanks!!

Reviews.Title: kodak easyshare
Reviews.Author: patti m rotenberry
Reviews.Content: camera worked less than 1 year,then picture threw lines in image so couldn't get focus on what i was trying to take picture of. TOTAL waste of $$$$$$!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Kodal Z915 camera
Reviews.Author: whitehawk
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for a number of years,and It always produces sharp, clear. crisp photo's.The only downfall to this camera is not enough zoom to reach out and capture distance shots.I have used it extensively for waterfall scenes and  in manual mode, it performs like a champ.This has been one of my most favorite cameras over the years.It has never failed me.

Reviews.Title: THIS CAMERA ROCKS IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Elleina G
Reviews.Content: When I got this Camera I was so afraid it was all hype and nothing great and well, my fears were laid to rest when I got this Camera!!! I LOVE this thing!! I carry it every where and its great for an amateur photographer to use. Specially if your not ready to get into the more expensive camera's yet. I would buy this a thousand times over if the one I have broke. You really need to play with the different settings and experiment with them to learn what the different settings work best for which for me was part of the fun of using it. I will show some photos I took with this camera if I can figure out how to do that!!!

Reviews.Title: kodak z915
Reviews.Author: dakota "Grasshopper"
Reviews.Content: My z915 camera works great. I've only used it to take pictures. If your a beginner like me it works great in auto mode; plus the flash work whens it feels its necessary for more light. I don't have to decide when to use the flash a big plus for a beginner I feel. I think my pictures look outstanding on the computer without any cropping. I got one blurry picture out of 39 taken;.thats shooting both indoors and out. I just plug in the usb port and it download to the computer rather quickly also without any problems. Please don't ask me any technical questions about this camera; because I basically know nothing other than to point and shoot it. Maybe as I use it more I will find some problems; but none so far. Image stabilization is also good as I have  shakey hands and even on extended zoom x10 it remains still.

Reviews.Title: Did Not Work
Reviews.Author: M. Adams
Reviews.Content: Did not work. Very disappointed. Many facets of the camera did not work. Very poor quality control. Returned and bought a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy!
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: Used and I got it just as the description. Works great. Good buy! Couple of scratches but for the price ok.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: N. Delorme "Internet shopper"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a couple years ago and have used it quite a bit. I find it is easy to use provided you take the time to read how to use it. People are often impatient and point and click without giving time for the device to focus. Just push the shutter button half way down and when the green squares appear push it down all the way and photos come out very nice. Only issue with this product is the mode selection button is near the shutter button and sometimes it is accidently switched from one mode to another without your knowledge unless you physically look at the mode button. You might think your in still photo and be recording a movie! So you must make certain which mode your in when taking photos or videos. Other than that it works well for our needs.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: J Love
Reviews.Content: I loved my first Kodak Easyshare so when my grandbaby broke my camera, I looked on Amazon to get a replacement..  I found one at a very good price.  I did not have to re-learn how to use it since I had previously owned one.  The seller was prompt about sending it and I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Deb H. "Deb"
Reviews.Content: This little camera does everything I want it to do and more. The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't have an Eye viewer. This makes it hard to see what you are shooting at when in bright sunlight so it is a guessing game in that aspect. I have taken several pictures that made it into juried photo contests using this.

Reviews.Title: Great Concert Camera
Reviews.Author: Mj Mccreary
Reviews.Content: I've used many point and shoot (P&S;) cameras for concert and this camera by far exceeded expectations. I am not a camera expert, but there is feature on the dial SCN, turn the dial to Stage and that takes great concert pictures. Aim your camera on the subject, when the green boxes appears, click it.  The delay (as in all digital P&S;) is not bad. actually pretty quick. Just slightly press on the clicker and it is ready to go again. I took this to the iheart radio concert in Vegas and the two lithium batteries lasted all night (5 hours) including taking videos. My battery is still 3/4 full. Great for everyday picture taking too. I Love going to concerts and have Sony, Olympus, and Canon P&S; and they failed me misserably in concerts due to low lights. Plus the delay is aweful and expensive.

Reviews.Title: Locks Up Occasionally
Reviews.Author: umkynd
Reviews.Content: I got this camera about a year ago, after my much more expensive camera ($600) broke. I don't want to compare apples and oranges, but I was pleasantly surprised by how well this camera can perform for the price.The battery life is nothing to complain about and the pictures (when taken in automatic mode) are typically crisp and well-focused. I miss my old camera most when I want to take large depth of field pictures (fuzzying out the background) or take numerous pictures in fast succession. The exposure leaves a little to be desired. Usually it is fine, but very high contrast and very low contrast settings tend to be washed out (in automatic mode). Finally, the stupid thing locks up now and again! This only happens about once in fifty uses, so I am not too worked up about it. However, be aware that you may lose a few good shots to this. I have.

Reviews.Title: Happy Camper AGAIN!
Reviews.Author: Dadof9yroldprincess
Reviews.Content: We bought a blue Z915 Kodak five or six years ago and have been very happy with its 10MP pic's and videos!  However not long ago the spring on the flap on the bottom of the camera broke and left me no choice but to use Gorilla tape to try to secure the flap.  If the flap did not have contact, no pictures!  :(  It was a pain to get the tape back each time the batteries needed recharged!  When I found this Z915 at a reasonable price, I was thrilled to get back to a flap that worked well!  It did not matter the camera was black instead of our original blue one, I was just glad to have a functioning camera WITHOUT the tape!  Disney, I am ready to come back to take some more pic's and video clips!  THANK YOU!  I am a Happy Camper with his camera again!  :)

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare
Reviews.Author: Sloughhouse Jack
Reviews.Content: I got hooked on Kodak Cameras years ago.I am not a professional photographer.Sad to say Kodak went bankrupt.I bought  this camera because I liked it for many years... but I dropped it and it broke.I bound this  as a replacement.

Reviews.Title: My "go to" camera
Reviews.Author: Nina N Brown
Reviews.Content: I have a 26X zoom digital camera, but never use it. This 10X zoom Kodak is the one I always grab. I've taken some great shots with this camera.  It's not as small as some, but small enough for me and you cannot beat Kodak for making everything simple to navigate and use. Too bad they're no longer in the business of making cameras. SOOOO glad I got this when they were!

Reviews.Title: Under-Rated Camera
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: This point and shoot is amazing. With a 10x optical zoom and 10 megapixels, the Kodak z915 is near DSLR style. The settings are simple and easy to use. The 10x optical zoom definitely comes in handy and especially the fact that the camera has a 0.3 second click-to-capture speed. I have used this point and shoot at sporting events and it does wonders. I love the camera modes, especially Panoramic and Sunset. This camera literally does it all.Long time exposures, sports, macros, landscapes, and high quality video.I love the fact that images can be made from videos.Great camera, definitely worth purchasing, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Z915 CAMERA
Reviews.Author: TED G STONE
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE 2ND EASYSHARE DIGITAL I HAVE OWNED AND IHAVE BEEN MOST SATISFIED WITH IT. I DO WISH IT HAD A VIEW FINDER TO GO ALONG WITH THE BACK DISPLAY AS IN BRIGHT SUN IT GETS WASHED OUT NAD YOU CAN'T TELL WHAT YOU ARE DOING. OTHER WISE A GOOD SIMPLE CAMERA TO USE.

Reviews.Title: Failed after just taking a few photos
Reviews.Author: TLW
Reviews.Content: After taking just a few photos, and turning the camera off then back on it requires me to reset the time and date. Really gets to be a pain in the A_ _

Reviews.Title: Digital Camer
Reviews.Author: Maurice J. Fox
Reviews.Content: The vendor provided these prompley  and the cost was just what I was Looking for.  Good Vendor and products Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Demond White
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in a timely fashion. It works great and I have not had any problems with it.  I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jenni
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for the every day picture taking family like we are! It zooms in great and is perfect for those school plays, outdoor picnics and more!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z915 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Virchow
Reviews.Content: I used to use an Canon AE-1 SLR film camera for work and hobby photography.  Then everything went digital and I had a few digital cameras, but upgraded to this Kodak Easyshare Z915 Digital Camera, which has fantastic features and is almost as good as the digital SLR cameras at one-fifth the cost.  I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't too happy with this one
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: This was a great camera for the time that it lasted.  It took great pictures but started to distort colors before it was even a year old.  I wasn't too happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: compact camera for beginners
Reviews.Author: Daffodil
Reviews.Content: Easy to shoot, compact and very good camera for less than $100. Wood recommend for beginners before you spend your money on the big SLRs.

Reviews.Title: KODAK Z915 CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Karla Bowers
Reviews.Content: THE CAMERA CAME IN RECORD TIME. IT COULD HAVE BEEN CLEANER, [A LITTLE FOOD FOR A SNACK, I GUESS], BUT GOOD WORKING CONDITION. WOULD BUY AGAIN

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z915 Digital Camera (Red)
Reviews.Author: R F Wojtaszak
Reviews.Content: What Can i say about a amazing camra that has a 10mpix range of photo opportunity to take in really colorfull pictures and video when required.However!!... This camra even with all its good perks which i might mention if i rember to... ( I was trying to use this camra Purly for the video mode it has) - The video cut point was 30 mins per video which in my mind isnt really a bad little thing for a camra of this statis, but that being what it is the camra has a verry verry bad habbit of sucking the life from batteries and even if you tryed recharables would not cover the time spent trying to make sure your  batteries where 100% charged before putting them into the camra before you could take your next shot and the camra sucking all the juice it could out of the batteries.If the batteries 2xAA btw where not enough to power the beast then it has this little light that would blink at you and just turn back off. Verry annoying camra, I only wish the power socket that this camra has on its side for 3.5 voits actually came with a plug for the wall.Great video / Great pictures / Great selection of modification on how to take your pictures but i think unless they come out with something that could be worthy of this camra STAY away from this one at all costs. its not worth your time.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Robert Medzi
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with it to date. Probably the clearest pictures you can get. Make sure you know how to use a camera before buying, otherwise you might have difficulty in taking good pictures (take a class).

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z915
Reviews.Author: NDD
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera. While my wife and I are not avid camera enthusiats when you need a camera this one doe the trick. Real good zoom and plenty of other features. The one thing I would change where the instructions. Give them to us only in English. i tore out the other languages, restapled, folded to put in with camera

Reviews.Title: good camera--good seller
Reviews.Author: paulus "paulus"
Reviews.Content: Used camera.  Arrived promptly in "like new" condition as promised.Pros:  compact. Not much bigger than older model point and shoot models.  (Fits very nicely in the hand.  Feels more like a point and shoot but with 10x zoom power!)  Intuitive menu and easy to navigate.  good placement of controls, except for on/off switch.  Takes very good pictures!  A good "learning camera" when you want to take more sophisticated pictures without a lot of setup.  Like how zooms lens tucks back flush into camera when turned off, with automatic lens cover shielding lens.  Oh,takes very good pictures! I'd buy again.Cons:  No view finder, which makes it sometimes difficult to line up a shot in bright sunlight. I didn't know how much I would miss this feature, but still not a deal breaker.  Used price of 85.00 was worth it.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular camera for a beginner!
Reviews.Author: Samuel J. Cook "Rehoboth Trades"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easy Share Z915 is an excellent camera, especially for those amateurs out there with a desire to start taking better photos. The focus on the camera is really good for objects close up, and the camera takes remarkable motion shots outside in natural light. However indoors, under unnatural light, motion produces undesirable blur. Also, another negative is that the camera eats up batteries.A little bonus, however, is that the camera can take videos with sound. The sound of the videos is of good quality; it does not have a tinny or bottle sound.All in all, the Easy Share Z915 is a splendid camera for a beginner who hopes to improve his/her photographic skills!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Scott Pribil
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple months now and have taken some fantastic photos with it. In automatic mode the camera is about 95% right on settings for simple shots. Complex shots need a little tweak but with a little photographic knowledge this camera is capable. My only complaint is battery life is poor; I don't think I've gotten more than 4-5 hours of mostly continual shooting. What is lacks in battery life it makes up in picture quality and general usability.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: I had an identical camera, but accidently dropped it (really hard). The camera, like most, is not indestructible! I wanted another camera exactly like it.  Found it and ordered it and it came immediately....perfect condition and very quick shipping time.  I like this camera alot.  Would buy from this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z915 is a great camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas Crane
Reviews.Content: Love my new Kodak EasyShare Z915, it is a great camera. You can set to Auto mode and use as a point and shoot or switch to manual and control functions to get as creative as you want. This camera takes beautiful, sharp pictures, even in low light conditions. This is my second Z915 and I am very plaesed.,My only complaint is to be careful of the battery door. I broke the little plastic clip, that holds the door shut, on my previous camera.

Reviews.Title: new camera
Reviews.Author: Paula J. Thomas "Paula Thomas"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a camera just like this one and loved it. I am really excited about getting this camera

Reviews.Title: Great price on so-so product
Reviews.Author: Oscar Chris Godoy
Reviews.Content: I was excited when I came across this camera for under $80! However, as my mom used to say "The cheap always turns out most expensive".  Although I've owned a Kodak Easy Share camera before, this one seems to have a win or lose outcome with the pictures it produces. Some pictures come out supersharp while others are washed out, blurry and all out too dark to see. Also seems to produce red eye in just about every picture. Some are correctable while a lot of others simply turn the red into bright yellow. Totally unacceptable! Next time, I'll spend the extra $ and purchase a Nikon or Canon.

Reviews.Title: FROM A SO--SO PICTURE TAKER
Reviews.Author: M-K
Reviews.Content: OVERALL I LIKE THE CAMERA. PIC QUALITY IS GREAT AND THE ZOOM IS VERY GOOD. HAVE TO LEARN WHAT THE SMALL ICONS MEAN. A BIG NEG IS THE VIEWING SCREEN WHEN YOU ARE IN SUNLIGHT. YOU CANNOT VIEW YOUR SUBJECT AND CAN ONLY GUESS. DOES ANYONE HAVE AN ANSWERE TO THE PROB?

Reviews.Title: kodak z915
Reviews.Author: schufitz
Reviews.Content: Good camera,good deal, 10 optical,10 megapixels.Not super high end camera,good pictures,bad software.It has been a good trusty camera.For about $120.00 I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: extremely happy
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: I ordered the camera on Sunday afternoon and received it Wednesday morning.  WOW - fast delivery.  I immediately took some quick photos and I am extremely happy with my purchase.  On my old camera, I had a problem with moving my camera slightly when I depress the "take a photo button" which would often result in fuzzy photos.  But with this camera, I haven't had that problem.  The close-up photos that I took of my Christmas cactus flower are so clear.  I also like the feature to create a panoramic photo.  I consider myself very amateur when it comes to taking photos.  Yes, I am extremely happy with this camera.  The price was better than I had seen at other stores.  And a battery charger was also included .  A great deal!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera with exceptional price
Reviews.Author: Huibi Wang "S. Linda"
Reviews.Content: I bought it from Dell.com at on sale price of $60. It turns out a great camera. In  door and out door pictures are good. I especially like the day stamp function, which lacks in many other cameras. The shutter speed is fast and 10x optical zoom is good too. Only negative thing is the bulk body.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this refurbished camera for my 10 year old son and he LOVES it!  It's easy to use and takes good photos.  The only negative thing is that the small boxy shape is difficult to hold onto.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted a nicer camera for Christmas so I found this Kodak camera.  The price was right and I like the packaged accessories that came with it.  My daughter has not put the camera down since Christmas.  The nice thing about it (for people like me) when you go to a different setting - it shows a short explanation for the setting.  Very easy to use - clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Daughter Loved this Camera Set
Reviews.Author: Anna's Mom
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our 16 year old - after she picked it out.  Love the camera & the entire gift set just wish Kodak made this with an internal rechargeable battery.  This is a great transition camera between a point & shoot & a camera with changeable lens.

Reviews.Title: Very Fine Camera
Reviews.Author: Stacey Chandler
Reviews.Content: This camera was ready to go as soon as I put the batteries in it. It is for the most part self explanatory. I agree with the guy who said that people are just too nit picky. The pictures are beautiful and the camera is simple to use.... What more do you need for that price!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!  Uses SD card, and Normal AA Batteries!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Kel Hess
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that did NOT take a special battery pack, and found this Kodak camera.  I've had it for a few months now and it has lived up to every expectation that I had.  It took a little bit of work learning how the auto focus works, as it is best to hold the snapshot button half way down for a moment, let the camera get focused, then push the rest of the way.  I guess I was used to my old 35mm camera where I just point and shoot.  The video mode works great too!  The camera is light weight, and small enough for my pocket.  I would suggest this camera for anyone who is shopping for a nice, small, easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures
Reviews.Author: spot wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife for her birthday. She really likes it and has takena lot of very good pictures. It takes better pictures than my Olympus camera. It was a very good purchase, with quick shipping and delivery. Thanks alot, Howard

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: beck
Reviews.Content: this is a great little camera  i had an old digital camera and the shutter speed is so much faster on this one  its great  also the 10x zoom lets you get up close to your subject from a distance  i am no profesional so havent tried some of the extra features but the basic picture taking is great  i wanted a good camera that takes quality pictures  good images of my kids, grandkids and wildlife  this camera works great for these things

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever that's not a slr
Reviews.Author: T. Sullivan
Reviews.Content: This is my second easyshare camera.  The other one I had for four years and needed an upgrade.  Couldn't afford a SLR but this camera does everything I wanted it to do.  The panorama selection is easy to use and has great pictures.  The video works great also.  I would highly suggest this camera for price and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Good all-around digital camera
Reviews.Author: E. Mason
Reviews.Content: Bought one for my wife, liked it enough to purchase a second for myself.  Brighter lcd than most, more flexibility or simple operation if desired.  Would still like a conventional viewfinder in addition to lcd, but these seem to be disappearing.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Gigliotti
Reviews.Content: this was very easy to use, as it told you what each setting is for. the only drawback is that you definitely need a media card cause it doesn't hold that much on its own.

Reviews.Title: Looks cool, works cool
Reviews.Author: J. Rock
Reviews.Content: Color saturation is very good, especially in P or M mode with exposure control set to negative values. Easy to see how your picture will look using viewfinder.Takes great pictures in low light, especially using tripod. See review at YouTube.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Valentina Lopez
Reviews.Content: I was looking for new camera to replase my stolen one. I needed something of a good size device, not mini. It wasn't easy to find one of this size which would be also well priced.
