And Kodak did it! I love to feel this camera in my hands, love the color, quality of pictures. 100% satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Lovin' the Easyshare Z915
Reviews.Author: Cathy Garrison
Reviews.Content: Kodak rocks!!!  Love the ease of use and the lightness of this camera.  It takes fantastic pictures and still only cost $139 at my Amazon source.LOVIN' IT!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Twee
Reviews.Content: After coming off of a terrible experience with Olympus, this camera has proven its worth and more. Excellent quality, excellent speed between shots, a good, solid feel, and ease of use that can't be beat. All of the controls and buttons are easy to use and understand.Me= Happy Puppy. My second EZ Share, and I promise I'll never stray from Kodak again.Spend up and buy a Kodak High SDHC memory card, not a cheap one that may be mislabeled. It makes the camera run even faster.Note that the SDHC cards cannot be read by older SD readers (I tried on a 5 YO machine). No big woop-- use the USB cable!

Reviews.Title: Quit working within 24 hours.
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Sharp
Reviews.Content: This item worked fine the first night (Christmas Eve) for the wife to take pictures of our Grand kids opening  gifts. The next morning the cameras flash just quit working. Tried everything on Kodak site to get it to work nothing, It's broke. Called Kodak and talked to a service rep and he agreed it was broke. I know things like this happen but to add insult Kodak wants me to pay shipping to send it to their service center. Thats BS. I have had several Kodaks before and have always had good luck with them but probably won't buy any more if this is the way they do their customers. AMAZON is great shipped item fast and I will continue to order from AMAZON but just not Kodak items.

Reviews.Title: Hidden "feature" dims display after only 10 seconds of inactivity.
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Warning to anyone considering this awful camera - despite many excellent features the camera has a hidden one ... the display automatically goes dim after only 10 seconds of inactivity making it virtually impossible to frame a shot or follow action. This "feature" is not described in any of the literature or instruction book that came with the camera and there is nothing you can do to bypass it. You can set the duration before the camera shuts off - up to 10 minutes. You can set the brightness of the display. But no matter what you set, the display dims after just 10 seconds. I tried to shoot pictures at an air show. By the time I found a plane in the viewfinder (bright sunny day) it went dim, so I had to fiddle with things to make it bright again, and the process was repeated. The manufacturer initially didn't acknowledge this built in time bomb - said I could set a menu to determine how long before the camera shut down to save batteries. But eventually they admitted that yes, the display dims after 10 seconds to save the batteries and there is no way to over ride it. I thought since I was buying through Amazon that the standard 30 day 100% refund policy would apply, but this sale was through one of their Amazon marketplace vendors who are allowed to charge up to 20% for restocking. And this vendor took every penny of it, despite the fact that this flaw in the camera was not disclosed before I bought it. Beware - even when supersaver free shipping applies it might not be Amazon who is the seller and you could get stung like I did. I will not be using Amazon as much as I used to because I am wary of the "fine print." I used to just know they stood behind merchandise, but ... they don't always. 20% is a huge restocking fee, especially when it was not returned for a frivolous reason.

Reviews.Title: Surprised at the horrible quality
Reviews.Author: J. Brock
Reviews.Content: I got tired of having to carry around a huge heavy SLR camera and all the stuff 2 kids require carried. I also need to take pictures for my job and it isn't practicle for me to carry it around while I work and I can't leave it sitting while I walk around for fear that someone would steal it. So I decided that I wanted a small point and shoot. I looked at this in the store and it had all the features I wanted at a really good price. I played with it in store and was not thrilled with the picture quality in the playback mode. I knew that that was not a true representation of what the final picture would look like so I called a friend to look up the reviews. With all the good reviews, I decided to go ahead and give it a try. An hour later I was ready to return it. Yes it is a great price and has a lot of nice features but the picture quality is horrible. I wasn't expecting the great quality I get from my SLR but I was expecting them to be decent. Most pictures came out blurry and grainy on all settings. The very very few (1 for every 15 pictures I took) that came out were very soft and dull. I exchanged it for a different camera the next day.

Reviews.Title: Seniors delite
Reviews.Author: Sam K. Riffel
Reviews.Content: What I like most being a senior is that all the picture modesare shown on the LCD screen so there is no guess work.Have been taking great pictures.Sam

Reviews.Title: Disappointing purchase.
Reviews.Author: sassy1
Reviews.Content: I found this camera to be too slow in responding to zoom and general picture taking.  All my pictures were off center because it didn't snap when I pushed the button.  It took too long to focus so when I captured my daughter walking down the aisle in a wedding, all I got was the side of her face.  I had to play the zoom twice because it didn't respond the first time.  I thought the housing was cheap feeling, fragile.  I'm frustrated since I need a camera and don't know where to look next.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Kennedy De Silva
Reviews.Content: This camera is superb because it has 12X optical zoom as appose to the 3x, which is unuasual for the price I acquired the camera for($129.00).I prefer optical zoom as digital zoom is a waste of time because it makes the images grainy.The price includes the camera, recharger, bag, 2 recharable batteries and 2 regular batteries.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Siri Kirtan Fluck "yogini"
Reviews.Content: Easy to yse; intuitive functions; fast; works well in low light.  Problem: software is a joke.  Still can't figure how to get video software to work.

Reviews.Title: LESS THAN 1 STAR: MINUS 10!
Reviews.Author: Pierre Fassie "Pierre  Fassié"
Reviews.Content: BEWARE of this camera. I do not recommend it.The software was loaded on 2 different computers, the supposedly "easy" Users Manual 3 steps were followed; different persons worked at it for hours and hours over several days and no one was ever able to download a single picture. Finally a small red button located on the back and labeled "share" was pushed and the pictures could be unloaded. NOWHERE in the Users Manual was it stated to push that button, its purpose is not listed nor explained anywhere.Many of the family pictures were partly out of focus; for instance, on the same picture, certain objects or a person were in focus but another person or the furniture in the background was not. It would be a waste of money to try and print such botched pictures.In close up eyes look green...Some of the 518 pictures were correctly dated and many others did not have a date; it is impossible to organize these non dated pictures.One feels the "good" pictures were made so by accident.One star is way too good for this useless object. For all the sorry frustration experience, MINUS 10 is what this piece of junk deserves.STAY WELL AWAY.

Reviews.Title: It was great while it lasted.......
Reviews.Author: NCMom
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased in July of 2010.  I was very pleased with it. The battery life seemed short but keeping extra batteries charged was not a huge problem.  The time delay between photos was a bit of a nuisance but again, not a huge problem.  However, two days ago, in the middle of taking photos, the camera suddenly flashed a "insufficient media storage"  message or something similar and then just turned off!  The lens is still extended.There was an SD card in the camera and unless I somehow mistakenly switched to the internal memory, should have been storing photos on that card which was not full. We have removed and recharged batteries.  Removed and reinserted the SD card.  Nothing works!  The camera will not turn on.  The retail on this camera was $199.95. It is two months out of warranty and apparently now useless.

Reviews.Title: Better than my Canon SX20
Reviews.Author: Wendell Sun "bigsun4212"
Reviews.Content: I ride bicycle on weekends with a local cycling club. I always take a point-and-shoot camera with me to photo-journal the ride. over the year, other members expected me to take the pictures of the ride and posted on Kodak Gallery ([...]). Recently my Kodak Z1486IS (small and light enough to carry in the back pocket of the riding jersey) went out of service, so I searched the Internet for the best mega-zoom camera and after reading many reviews, I bought a Canon SX-20 ($369.99), thinking it will give me better pictures.The pictures taken by Canon SX-20 looked sharp enough on the monitor, but with the size and the weight of the camear, it was hard to use during the ride, so I was forced to look for another camera. I found Kodak Z915 at a local Staple, and with the clearance price of $45.95, it was a great deal.What really surprised me is that now I am taking photo classes at a local community college, and the resolution of the photos from Kodak Z915, when using Photoshop CS5 to enhanced the contrast or color balance, reads 480 pixels/inch vs. 180 pixels/inch of Canon SX-20. When I print the pictures at 30" x 40" (the largest size school's Chromira printer allowed), it is so sharp that the teacher thought I used a digital single-lens reflex camera. The print from my Canon SX-20 was so soft (low res) at 30" x 40", I was embarrassed to show the print to other members of the club.I am more than satisfied with Kodak Z915. As for others' complain of blurry pictures, I read and followed Kodak's manual (press the shutter button half way and wait for the green mark, once appeared on the LCD display, the camera has found the subject and it's in focus (page 4 of the manual explain this simple procedure to produce sharp pictures).I still take pictures with my Nikon F4 or Mamiya RB67 Pro-SD for serious projects, but for quick and easy day-to-day picture taking, I am totally convinced that Kodak Z915 is one of the best, for price and the print quality, out there.

Reviews.Title: "It's not the looks that really count.  It's what's on the inside that really matter."
Reviews.Author: Voltaire
Reviews.Content: Form:It looks basic, but I like the "stealth" look.  I think it actually looks more elegant than the color-painted cameras.  But who really pays attention to your camera?  Hopefully the people that are cheesing for you, at least.  It doesn't try to look expensive... because it really isn't.  It does feels solid, however, and appropriately sized for my banana hands.Function:The zoom on this camera is unbelievable, until you actually try it.  I didn't know a compact camera could have so much lens extension AND retain great quality memories.  For example:  I go to NBA games, but sit pretty far on the 2nd level, nose bleeds of the arena, the best point of view.  With the zoom, I can actually take close up shots of the action on the court, post it on Facebook and comment that I had VIP seats.  Yeah... that's right.  Haha.  I also love the explanations for the different photo settings... they really help in selecting the right setting for the different kind of shots for a newb like me.  Some functions may be obvious, like the icon of the "running man".  But, of course, I knew it wasn't just for taking pictures on the run.  The auto setting is great too, if you're unsure what to use.  But I shouldn't have an excuse not to use the settings, since they explain it to you on screen.  I haven't tampered with the manual settings, yet, nor the video.  Internal memory is pretty pathetic, so I recommend installing at least a 2gb SD card (which can hold at least 100 pictures at max resolution), not included.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera when it worked
Reviews.Author: Johnny Morant Jr.
Reviews.Content: This camera is fairly easy to use, just aim and snap.  You have to use the LCD screen and all of our pictures looked grainy on the lcd, but came out great.  After about 500 pics in the span of 7 months, the camera shutter would not open, it just clicks.  Changed the batteries, blew some air in it just in case something was lodged in the grooves and nothing.  I can not recommend this to anyone due to the lack of durability.

Reviews.Title: Some pluses, some minuses
Reviews.Author: David Jackson
Reviews.Content: This camera has many pluses.  It has good zoom and pixel qualities.  I like that you need not have a lens cover as it closes and covers when turned off.  It is quite compact, and has a good viewer screen.  It continues the setting capabilities of this type of camera.  Minuses.  I would prefer the type of battery which is a single battery and can be recharged and hold a charge for quite a number of pictures.  The internal memory is not very big.  The feature on previous models which allowed a person to look through a finder instead of using the viewer screen is missing.  In sunlight it is a bit difficult to view with the viewer screen.  The finder on previous models I preferred.  I am only now becoming familiar with this camera.  I have bought the rechargeable batteries and recharger and have yet to see how they work out.

Reviews.Title: better than i thought, good pics
Reviews.Author: wyoming
Reviews.Content: i started using film camera when i was 6 and i have owned and tryied different film and digital cameras. so i'm not a photographer but i have a bit of experience.i know that a compact camera with a 10X zoom and a standard 1/2,33" sensor can't do great quality pics. expecially if you've paid it 100.i bought this camera in july for the summer and took about 2000 pics and when i saw on pc i was surprised by the results. it makes good pics and as manual controls that are necessary in my opinion.on the minus side i have noticed occasionals error of the withe balance and the af is a bit slow. as most of the other compacts it shouldn't be used above 400iso.the pics are 2mb so they are very compressed and somethimes you can see that.all in all i'm impressed by the value for money, samsung wb600 can do better pics in my opinion but cost twice as much.kodak saved money on the body wich looks much cheaper than the samsung, the software is slow so it can take a bit of time if you look the pics or when you turn on etc..the quality.... well my camera broke after less than 3 months but the serice was great. every camera i owned broke exept the indestructable nikon fm2, so maybe is a question of karma. but i suspect that kodak saved money even on the general quality but if you have the warranty is ok.

Reviews.Title: Exelente camara.
Reviews.Author: L.F.G.B.
Reviews.Content: Cuando adquiri esta camara de kodak y por el precio que la compre nunca me imagine la exelente compra que habia hecho, cuando la recivi fue muy grato ver que es simple de usar y lo mejor aun que la calidad de las fotografias y del video son verdaderamente exelentes, los accesorios y por tanto la camara en si, son de muy buena calidad, la recomiendo ampliamente.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z915
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: The Kodak EasyShare Z915 is an excellent camera for the money. I purchased it on amazon for a little over $100.  I have used it to take photos under all kinds of lighting conditions. The photos mostly come out well because the camera is very versatile. When you change a setting on the camera, the new setting is explained on the screen. You don't have to memorize a bunch of symbols. The video feature is not in HD but the videos also come out very well too. The biggest drawback to the camera is  that there is only one screen. It lacks a view finder and it is difficult to see the screen in bright sunlight. The only other drawback is that battery life is not the best. On the other hand it only needs two AA batteries at a time to work. All and all the camera has been great.

Reviews.Title: Great value in bright light, lousy at night
Reviews.Author: J. Bowman "Bookworm"
Reviews.Content: In a well-lit scene, the Z915 camera is a fantastic value the price, especially at nearly half the price I paid. Power to picture is under a second, so you can turn it on and still catch that once-in-a-lifetime moment before it's gone, the #1 reason I chose this. It's by far the fastest in its class. Unfortunately, I will probably have to buy a pricier SX20 for night shots and concerts, and it's pointless to carry two similar cameras.The camera is very light and just barely pocketable in a jacket, big plusses. The superzoom is very quick to telescope in retract, and pictures are of excellent quality at either end with very little fringing, distortion, or blurring. Details pop without as much of the characteristic Kodak smoothing and sharpening. The flash is quite powerful and often exposes perfectly as long as the focus is correct - but it can sometimes be too bright and wash out detail, especially around interesting lighting. It is possible to lower the flash power in manual mode.It's also easier on the batteries than the average camera. I have a cache of AA around all the time, but I so rarely run out of power on a shooting session that I hardly ever take them with me anymore. In the past I've had cameras that left me high and dry, but despite the Z915 only taking 2 AA I've only had that happen once. Then again, I rarely use it after dark like the others.The one thing it can't do is night shots - don't even bother taking it to a club. It's almost completely unable to autofocus or meter in the dark - a common problem with all of the Kodaks I've owned - and there's no manual focus to fix it. Worse if there's any fog or haze. 90% of dark shots will be blurry, under/overexposed, or had motion blur, always full of grain, and shot time also slows while it hunts for focus. Good luck getting anything at all without a flash. You can manually meter, but without a focus there isn't much point. In my experience, only cell phones are worse at this; all of the Kodaks I've had were much more reliable. Macro mode focus is also not particularly good.When it works, however, the focus graphics are handy, showing both the focus point and faces, and on review shows quite a bit of photo details that can help meter further pics better. Alternate shooting modes are very complete, High ISO is particularly useful in the shadows. Some folks might like that it has Myspace Mode (Self-portrait). I've never used the on-camera editing features.Overall, I'd say that as long as you don't need concert & club photos, this is a fantastic value for the money. It's not perfect for me, but it's inexpensive, reliable, fast, and otherwise top quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Utilitarian Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Piltzer "Rocklen"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera on Amazon for the amazingly low price of $88 delivered.  I use a higher end Panasonic digital for my online store photos as most are shot using macro so this camera was strictly purchased as a pocket camera for travel.  It fits that usage perfectly.  If there is any complaint it would be that it is a little too large for most pockets, otherwise it is a sturdy workhorse and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Really nice
Reviews.Author: Linda  Bryant "LKB"
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for a short time but I've already taken around 400 pictures with it.  I am amazed at the ease of use, and the quality of the pictures.  I have and still do own several Kodak cameras, but this one seems to out perform the rest by a landslide. The battery life is amazing, and the 10 power zoom brings things in a lot closer than the standard 3 power zoom.  Landscape or photos, you'll be happy you chose this Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Mixed feelings
Reviews.Author: Tippetarius
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for a previous z series camera because I wanted more megapixels.  I have mixed feelings about the purchase. Of great importance, is that the picture quality is very good and it has a lot of optional manual settings.  The zoom is also better than my last camera.  But I don't like the fact that there is no viewfinder (but this is now the case with most cameras); videos come out shaky because it is hard to stabilize the camera, and when in bright sunlight or trying to take a video or picture of something that is moving, it is hard to do with just the LCD screen, and it eats up the batteries quickly if you don't keep shutting it off when not immediately in use.  Speaking of which the on/off button is tiny and is in front of the setting dial, so it is not easy to use.  The other buttons are just as small, but raised up slightly and more conveniently located.  The cover for the place to attach a usb cable is very flimsy, and it gets in the way of the plug, so that you have to keep pulling at the cover until the plug finally snaps in, and I am assuming the cover will eventually break off.  It is nice to have the charger, usb cable, and batteries provided, but the case is so small, it is essentially unusable; it won't fit anything other than the camera and sd card; there is no room for spare batteries!When there are videos to download to the computer, the camera software can't handle doing it by usb; it will appear to be making progress, but then will display error messages, and you won't be able to download any of the pictures taken after the video if using the usb. However, I found out that inserting the memory card into my laptop is a fast and easy way to transfer the videos and pictures.  You will need the latest QuickTime 7 program to view the videos (which is avaible free online).  But a major problem in my opinion is that these videos are not compatible with other programs or websites, so you will need a program to convert them (to AVI or MOV).  When I contacted Kodak about a conversion program, they said I should be able to find one free online, and them mentioned one site but could not guarantee that it was safe (free of viruses or spyware, etc).  And it turns out the site they mentioned was not a free program, you could download it for free but if you didn't register and pay $$ there would be a large watermark in the middle of the video saying it was unregistered. So I decided to upgrade QuickTime 7 to the Pro version for an additional $30. Honestly, I think Kodak should provide a free conversion program, but they obviously have some sort of agreement with Apple/Quicktimeto get your money.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase
Reviews.Author: Christie M. Olson "Christie"
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with this item. The camera was purchased as a package--on sale-- for less than $200.00. I was very pleased, since I had a $200 limit. I continue to learn more about the camera in relation to lighting. For example, I noticed that in black-light environments that it gets blurry. However, there are different light settings on the camera itself. Overall, this was a worthwhile purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy for The Money
Reviews.Author: JCM
Reviews.Content: I have lusted after a 10X zoom camera for several years and when I saw this one listed I snapped it up.  I have not been disappointed.  It is a great buy for the money.  My wife and I just returned from a tour of India and I was one of the few people in our group who did not have some sort of camera problem.  I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Cheap - effective and way better quality than other cameras in it's class.
Reviews.Author: CBRadioMagazine "CBradiomagazine"
Reviews.Content: We don't have much money and needed a $99 camera for taking pictures of our kids.We went through three cameras at best buy returning each one because 1 in 3 pictures was blurry, overlit, etc.Coolpix, Olympus, Panasonic - all the $99 typw cameras were terrible.This thing has been awesome - it's bigger and more bluky but it actually takes really nice photos. Good quality, nice color, great zoom and the videos look great too.I'd buy this one again any day over the others. It's been 6 months and zero problems.Only downside is you need the kodak software installed to download pictures, but I download them and then shut down the software afterwards (it's uses a lot of computer memory will running.)

Reviews.Title: Love It! Better than the Z950
Reviews.Author: VieraMom
Reviews.Content: I bought the z950 and thought the whole processing time thing was way too slow for me. Then I bought the m530 and didn't care for the quality of the photos or the flash. The Z915 camera is perfect for me. I already own the Z812is and needed some thing small to carry around with me. I looked at the smaller Nikons and Canons as well and they did not compare to this one. The quality of this one is much like the Z950 but it is so much faster. My photos look bright, clear and sharp! It feels good in my hands...like I have a camera in my hands. The flash is great, the timing is awesome. I've been using cameras for decades and this is my 5th digital camera. I usually go with Sony's but because I like my Z812 so much decided to stick with Kodak. Then with all of the good reviews and the sale on this one...I'm so glad I bought this one. CNET rated it one of the top 10 cameras last year. For under $100 its a steal. I paid $99 at a local office supply store. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my 14 year old daughter
Reviews.Author: Soccer dad "Soccer dad"
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for my 14 year old daughter to replace an older easy share camera.  She loves the camera and I have had an opportunity to play with it (including the panoramic mode).  The picture quality is very good.  Settings/controls are user friendly.  I would recommend this camera as a cost effective alternative to some of the higher end camera's of the same zoom range and megapixels.

Reviews.Title: great camera, excellent zoom easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jamie Sue Baird "Emma's Mom"
Reviews.Content: Kodak is sooo easy to use. this camera has a built in manuel. at any time if your unsure of what a settign does you push the i button and it fully explains what that setting is good for. this alone makes me love the camera. the zoom is awesome. I was looking for a small camera that had excellent zoom since we do a lot of boating and have a little girl. this is the one. its cheap, easy to use and takes great pics. not sure what else a mom would want in a camera. I also bought the high speed memory card. this camera takes picture with no delay. yes I would reccomend it anyone.

Reviews.Title: Super Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: christy123
Reviews.Content: This small, adorable camera takes clear clean shots- the 10x zoom is incredible.  My only complaint is that it wasn't available in red.  It came prompty (I ordered just before vacation)  I have enlarged several shots to 8x10 and the quality is fantastic

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bret Winters
Reviews.Content: This Kodak camera seems to take as good of pictures as our Canon PowerShot SX100 10XZoom camera. Great price on Amazon, much cheaper than what we paid for our Canon and has many of the same features. We loved our Canon, but dropped it one too many times and it doesn't work well now. We wanted a camera for a lesser price that had many of the smae features and found that in this Kodak model.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gwen Hill "Granna"
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my husband. He wanted a simple, but good camera. He is very happy with it and thinks it fits real well with his needs.  we are having Vacation Bible School and he is taking the pictures.  Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Bretton
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of the zoom capabilities and because of the price. My husband and I just recently went to Tennessee and I got to use the camera. I LOVE IT! It took amazing pictures and the Kodak software that came with it allowed me to enhance and tweak my pictures a little bit. I'm not a camera or computer genius and I found this camera and software so easy to use!I would have to say the only negative to this camera is that it eats thru batteries fairly quick. I was using the camera a lot though, but my old camera was a Sony with a rechargeable battery and I have to say I miss that feature.

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot ever
Reviews.Author: S. Baum
Reviews.Content: I had a camera with 8X optical zoom that was nearly impossible to get good clear pictures with whenever I used the zoom option.  The Z915's stabilzation capabilities compensate for my inability to become motionless while taking pictures.  I can produce clear pictures with ease now, even while driving down the road.  This is the best camera I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share Z915
Reviews.Author: K. Perkowski
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the 10X Optical Zoom.  I sell items over the internet and needed to be able to take detailed pictures.  I found it both easy to use and understand thanks to the on camera instructions.  I'm still learning, but I have already had some great success getting the details I wanted.  However, I was not overly impressed with the Kodak software.  Perhaps it is me and I am not grasping it as I should, but I found it lacking in flexibility.  I couldn't get my pictures out of it and into the application I wanted.  I solved the problem by using a converter drive to download my pictures instead of sending them directly from the camera.  It was the best zoom for the price and I am very pleased with my purchase.  The quality of my pictures has already shown definite improvement.

Reviews.Title: An excellent camera as a spare
Reviews.Author: Alexandre Nassif "A. Nassif"
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. An "eye catch": really beautiful vintage look filled with OK electronic guts. Its looks were what mainly drive my willingness to buy it.2. Small, yet powerful 10x optical zoom.3. Speed: very fast for a budget camera.4. Price (mine cost $80 plus tax).5. Size and weight (light and small).Cons:1. Uses "AA" batteries.2. Blurs while zooming in video mode.3. Pictures below average when indoors and flash disabled.Small complains:1. Flimsy lens cover.2. The software included is a disgrace... don't even bother trying to install it! Since I wouldn't use it anyways, I don't care.3. The wristband is inadequate for this camera... it should use a strap, since the camera is not that small - it is not a pocket camera.Conclusions: Get it IF you need a spare camera (I have a Nikon DLSR + a Nikon film SRL + a Canon SD780 ... I guess I wanted something to fill in the gap between the teeny tiny Canon and my DLSR) AND it is on sale (you'd be crazy to pay $200 on this), AND you want something cheap to take everywhere and not to worry about it being broken/stolen, and yet have a great looking camera with a powerful guts.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Seebach311 "Seebs311"
Reviews.Content: If there was a 4.5 star I'd give this camera that.CNET ([...]) offers a great review of this camera ([..]), rating it the "TOP RATED" budget camera-a video review is also available.  I got it for $115 from Amazon.  Everything is good about the camera except their is no view finder, which makes you rely on the LCD screen, which is fine unless its very sunny outside and it then is difficult to see.  I'm using Kodak rechargeable batteries and they last FOREVER.  From a capacity standpoint,I get 2250 pictures on the highest setting (10 megapixel) on an 8gb high capacity memory card (about $20).  Lots of flexibility on the camera, I was able to use the shutter priority (with a tri-pod)($22 Walmart-probably available here) to take some amazing flash-free night photos.  Excellent photo quality (I had a 20x30 photo printed without pixelation).  Camera fits in a dress shirt pocket, though I bought a case (also at Wal-Mart $9.00).  10x zoom is all you could ever need unless you plan on using a tri-pod for every picture, at this zoom level its almost impossible to hold the camera steady, even with the automatic picture steadying built into the camera- a digital zoom is included that will take you beyond this level (digital zoom artificially moves further into the picture and rapidly decreases quality, I never use the feature).  Camera clues in you in if it is not able to auto-focus (AF turns red), if it needs to flash based on the setting for a proper exposure, or if you will need to pay special attention to holding it steady (i.e. a non-flash night shot-it shows you a shakey hand icon).  There are multiple "Scene" settings within allowing you to easily adapt to scenes from snow, candlelight, self-portraits, etc.  Comes with Kodak Easy Share software which had minor picture editing software included (photo improvement and cropping, not actual manipulation like Photo Shop).  I am amazed at the quality of picture you can obtain from this camera, and the price is unbeleivable.

Reviews.Title: Easy share Z915
Reviews.Author: Donald J. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I have the oppotunity to use several cameras in this class and this was the best of the bunch.  Very easy to use and learn.

Reviews.Title: The best camera for your money!
Reviews.Author: Michael Brezler "Dart Enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes fantastic photos and is extremely user friendly.The best in it's class for under $200.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality camera.
Reviews.Author: David A. Lefurgey
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Z915 seemed to be just the camera I was looking for until I got it.  It is a "plastic fantastic."  To hold in in your hand is to be afraid to drop it and see it smashed to pieces.  I do not like that it has no optical viewfinder, only the screen.  I should have caught that before I purchased it. My greatest concern is that the audio that one records with the video is barely audible -- if you can hear it at all -- through the camera.  This is a design problem in the camera.  Who paid those engineers to design this flaw into the camera?  One can even check the Z915s in the store and discover this.  When I called Kodak, they just ran be through the menu and said their was nothing they could do.  Shame on you Kodak.  I had to send it back to the Amazon Marketplace seller to have them exchange it. The new camera is the same as the old.  I wouldn't purchase this camera again, and it is too much of a hassle to keep sending it back -- for what?  I will wrap it up and give it to someone as a Christmas gift.  MERRY CHRISTMAS.

Reviews.Title: Not Good at Point-Click-Go Pics
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Payne
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on Black Friday 2010 last year, got a great deal.  I did research before my purchase and I got the impression this was a great point and shoot camera, which is exactly what I wanted.  I never thought it took good pictures, most of them were grainy.  I called and talked to Kodak customer service & they said the only way to get better pics was to manually focus it every time, and mess with the settings, which is great if you are into photography, not so great if you are trying to catch a cute pic of your energetic 3-year-old.  So after 6 months of forcing myself to use my "new" camera, I finally accepted that I hated it, sold it used online, and went back to using my 8-year-old Olympus digital camera that is still easier to use and takes better pics than my "new" Kodak.I hated this camera so much that I will probably never buy another one, I found it not very user friendly and the pic quality was not all that great.  If you are into messing with the settings and taking the time to adjust your settings for each and every pic, this is the camera for you, but if you want point-click-go, then I'd recommend you buy something else.

Reviews.Title: The Best Digital that I've had so far!
Reviews.Author: A. Sims
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write a long review on an item (and this one won't be all-inclusive), but I have to make an exception for this camera! I saw this camera package on sale shortly before I went on vacation and wanted it on my vacation so I paid for the 3-day shipping. That was money well-spent! I am amazed(and so are others who have seen the pictures) at how well this camera takes pictures! I was really impressed with the zoom. To compare a regular shot with a zoomed shot, I took a regular shot of Haystack Rock in OR, and then zoomed in on a bird that was sitting on it. Where you could barely see that there was a bird in the regular shot, you could almost see the individual feathers in the zoomed shot! The layout of the buttons is also very well done. There is a dedicated button right next to the shutter to turn off the flash (but does not intefere with taking a picture). Just below it is a button that aids in shooting close-up shots, very nicely indeed. On the back of the camera are the delete, setup, info (help), and review buttons. If you take a picture and don't like how it looks, you can easily push the delete button and get rid of it. Even though there is a nice-sized viewer on the back, I did not find this camera eating batteries. There are so many number of preset ways to take a shot that I haven't explored them all yet, but I do like the Sport setting and the Panorama setting which allows you to take three pictures and then it threads them together very nicely for you.As noted earlier, there are several presets that will help any photographer take a good shot. I haven't explored them all yet, but I have been impressed with the ones I have! I haven't tried out the transfer because I just pop out the micro-SD card, pop it into a reader, and transfer them that way. This is an excellent camera, one that I believe I'll have many hours of happiness with!

Reviews.Title: not a good camera for taking pictures of busy kids
Reviews.Author: crystalchik1
Reviews.Content: I am a mom who mostly takes pictures of my kids, and I wanted to upgrade my basic point and shoot with something with more zoom. I was a little skeptical since the price of this camera is so low compared to other similar cameras, but the reviews have been generally good, so I gave it a try.The camera was easy to use and the pictures were fine - but it took forever for the camera to be ready for the next shot. The preview of the last shot stayed on screen for quite a long time, much longer than my previous Nikon. The only way around this was to turn the preview off completely, which I didn't like either. I do usually like to see the shot right away - but quickly. If you are trying to take pictures of kids or other things that move quickly and you need to take several shots right in a row, this is probably not the camera for you.Based on this, I returned the camera and bought another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Oh Snap!
Reviews.Author: J. Stinnett "Ms. It"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare Z915 is a beautiful camera ready to use right out of the box. Being an amateur, I am still trying to figure out what all it can do. It really is more camera than I need for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z915
Reviews.Author: Julie Shmil
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a recent trip to Rome, Italy. I love the camera and it takes GREAT pictures. The zoom and panaromic feature is a BIG plus!! The only thing that with this camera that is not a plus, is that it does not use rechargeable batteries!! So every time the battery runs out, you have to buy new batteries.Otherwise, I reccomend this camera to beginners and non-beginners alike!!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Rocio Cabrera-salazar "Rocio C."
Reviews.Content: We bought this product for Christmas and we have been using the camera since that day all the time. Easy to use, great pictures, easy to handle. It is a great product at a very good price

Reviews.Title: Great camera, Great price!
Reviews.Author: G. Van Sant
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for the 10X Zoom and it's awesome! Quality pictures, excellent overall camera at a great price from AMAZON!! Easy to use, simple instructions and online "advanced manual"...

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Jessica D. Wamback
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mother for her 50th birthday, and then had her first grandchild four days later! She has been non-stop taking pictures of the baby, experimenting with all the cool features on the camera to get the best shot! This camera is great for someone who just wants to point and shoot, or someone who wants to try artistic things with their photography!

Reviews.Title: Returned it as soon as I could
Reviews.Author: L. Young
Reviews.Content: This camera was nothing like I was expecting. The first thing I noticed was how "cheap" it seemed. It is extremely light weight, like there is nothing in it. It has just basic functions for a digital camera. Taking pictures is horrible, by the time it does it's series of light flashes and focuses, my subjects (my children) had moved on and I would often get the backs of their heads, etc, and lose the shot. The time between pictures seems like forever. There was nothing I liked about this camera, I returned it and bought a Nikon and am in heaven!

Reviews.Title: Falls Apart easy.
Reviews.Author: Brent Scherer
Reviews.Content: Got two of these cameras. One for me and one for my cousin. My cousin had it hanging on her wrist, bumped it against a cabinet, and the thing was killed like the connection to the power supply got severed somewhere inside the camera. In mine, I've never bumped it or banged it into anything and the connection to set off the flash got messed up so it rarely flashes and often just has this nasty yellow picture because the camera was expecting a flash but the flash never went off.LCD Screen is nice, optical zoom is nice, but the camera itself is cheaply made and the extra functions will be worthless to about 95% of people. It's also too bulky to be one of those camera you stash in your pocket. I just wanted a nice camera I could take around and snap photos but it couldn't even handle that. Both cameras were essentially dead within a year. I'm sure if I had the camera for a week or two I'd leave a raving review like most people on here but it's been a few months and both of the cameras are done for. Save your money and buy a better camera than this one. It'll be a much better value in the end.

Reviews.Title: kodak, mi mejor eleccion en cuanto a camara
Reviews.Author: M.M "montipower"
Reviews.Content: QUERIA UNA BUENA CAMARA Y LA ENCONTRE CUANDO COMPRE LA KODAK Z915. ESTA CAMARA COMBINA UN EXELENTE ZOOM CON UNA BUENA IMAGEN, PARA UNA PERSONA QUE LE GUSTE LA FOTOGRAFIA.TIENE UN EXELENTE PRECIO(COMPRE LA MIA EN UN PRECIO ESPECIAL DE $95), ME ENCANTA ESTA CAMARA, SI PENSABAS COMPRARLA HAZLO ES UNA BUENA OPCION. QUIERO CAMBIAR LA MIA POR UNA DE MAYOR ZOOM, PERO ESTOY ENCANTADO CON ELLA Y POSIBLEMENTE NO LA VENDA Y ME QUEDE CON ELLA, AUN COMPRANDO LA Z981, PUES A MI ESPOSA LE GUSTA ESTA CAMARA.

Reviews.Title: Typical Kodak
Reviews.Author: Alissa M. F. Elghazi "Alissa"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used this camera all that much so I haven't had a chance to test the longevity of the batteries yet.  I was disappointed to discover that the camera only holds 5 pictures in its memory, but I am using an old kodak photo chip from my last kodak that ended up going through the washing machine.  The camera came on time.  Picture quality is okay, what I would expect from a kodak.  So far, the camera is VERY user friendly, so that is greatly appreciated.  The zoom is in an awkward spot for me, but I'll get used to it.  Shutter speed is normal for a kodak as well.  I was impressed by the quality of the camera though, it FEELS like I could drop it two stories without it breaking, but I'm not going to try it out.I think the camera package would have been more worthwhile had a photo memory chip actually been included.  I'm not ecstatic over this product, but I feel like I have almost exactly what I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: Very good!!!
Reviews.Content: Encantado totalmente con este prodcuto. La relacion precio y calidad es excelente. La promocion del estuche y el cargador de baterias estas buenisimo. Recomendada 100%.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, couple disappointments
Reviews.Author: jyates
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, though when it arrived it felt quite cheap/lightweight in my hands compared to my previous camera, the Z1285. But, it just has more plastic casing, the camera is good quality and works well.  My son broke my previous one, so we got this  as a quick and cheaper replacment.  Still has all the great Kodak features, but unfortunately doesn't take the Kodak dual rechargeable battery packs that we already had. (two NiMH AA batteries attached to each other) It instead requires 2 separate AA batteries. We can still get rechargeable ones of those, and plan to, but I wish it had specified in the description that it ONLY takes separate batteries.  I have 4 sets of the other battery packs! However, I can still use my Kodak charger when I get the new batteries, and I can always use the regular AA ones in a pinch.  My fault for "assuming" that because it took AA size NiMH batteries I could use what I already had.The "smart capture" feature works OK, but gets blurry with any movement, so I am using the sport setting a LOT since my son is 20 months old.  The Z1285 "smart scene" feature was much more reliable, but again, this z915 camera is a lesser, older, cheaper model so I have to keep that in mind.Overall I gave it a 4 star rating because it came as advertised, worked great out of the box, is fully compatible with my easyshare software and printer, and we got some GREAT outdoor shots the first day I used it. Easy to use, fantastic zoom, (10X!!) and compact enough to not be in my way while chasing my toddler. :)

Reviews.Title: Best buy for the buck. A***** buy.
Reviews.Author: brana
Reviews.Content: I have Agfa, Fuji, Nikon, Samsong cameras before. But This Kodak Z915 camera beats them all in picture quality.good zoom, excellent picture in low light, you can easily compare Z915 with highend cameras.Price at $75.00 you can not beat this. A***** buy.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: whatever
Reviews.Content: Good price for the whole package. But I have a lot of difficulty loading the images onto my computer. The supplied connector doesn't function well. I have to plug and unplug it several times to get it to connect. That's frustrating. Being old school, I'd like a view finder, especially in bright sun.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera!
Reviews.Author: Angela Rice
Reviews.Content: Okay before this camera I was using a Koday Easyshare MD853 camera that I was given for Christmas about 2 years ago. I loved that camera and was the best camera I had ever had, and while using this camera, I realized that photoraphy was a field I could really get into and still work on to this day.  But unfortunetly got broke.So now it was time to look for a new camera. I looked and looked, but nothing made me happy the way my old camera did. Until I came accross the Koday Easyshare 2915.I was very pleased with the optical zoon it has on it, and the value of the pictures it takes. I have had this camera for about a month now and my only complaints are the thinkness of the camera and that it takes batteries instead of lithium batteries that I like better. But if you buy quality batteries like Duracell or Energizer, I've found it last a  lot longer. But all in all it is a great camera, and I hope to use it for a long time!

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Teresia
Reviews.Content: The camera is clear, I can take pics of my friends moving in motion. I love that it came with a case, travel charger, regular batteries and rechargeable batteries.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Ppacheco
Reviews.Content: Good stuff, same as description i am happy with this purchase on the box brand new :-)

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Smith
Reviews.Content: I have waited 2 months before reviewing this camera to give myself time to really try it out.  So far, I can find nothing to complain about.  I am extremely happy with it, find it very easy to use and the quality of the pictures is amazing.  Also amazing was Amazon's service.  I ordered it on Monday morning and had it in my hands Tuesday evening!

Reviews.Title: Simple to use
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Bought a refurbished model,  and they sent the small (5 3/8 in square)user guide with it.  The "how to" info was succinct, helpful.  The viewer is small but quite clear. The Panorama feature was simple to do. Has a load of features for a compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for MOM!
Reviews.Author: FISHPHOTO
Reviews.Content: Wow! I was searching for a replacement camera for my Mother.  She left her previous camera was left on the hood of a car and met an unfortunate demise.  I did some research and some comparative shopping and settled upon this Kodak model.  My daughter had a Kodak first and I loved the pictures it created.  I bought a carry around Kodak that my wife confiscated.  So that helped in the decision.  But when I bought this one for my Mom, I needed simplicity, an d great pictures.  When she opened it up we were in the darkest restaraunt imaginable.  After I loaded the batteries for her, she proceeded to take a picture of my sister in this dark environment.  I tried to warn her that it was too dark and would probably not turn out well.  But the word we used when we saw the end result, was the same as the first word in this review.  WOW!  The picture taken in almost complete darkness with the flash on the Z915 was awesome!  We could not believe our eyes.  Now what makes me qualified to know a good picture when I see one?  I shoot portraiture professionally and have over $6k worth of Canonbody and lenses.  This is one point and shoot that I am proud to recommend.  Buy it at any price, but for what it is selling for currently it is a SCREAMING BARGAIN!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased! Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Voracious Reader
Reviews.Content: I have had several Kodak Easyshare cameras and was looking for a new one.  I wanted and Easyshare and had decided that I would buy the M550 when Amazon made the Kodak Z915 the deal of the day!It is a wonderful camera!  Love the photos, the ease of using the camera!  I highly recommend this!  Everything I wanted in my new camera!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Catherine Hogan "khogan"
Reviews.Content: The only thing I reall don't like about this camera is that the manual is not complete. They tell you to go on line to read more. That stinks.  I want to be able to take it with me so I can refer to it. Yes, the camera has helps built in but that doesn't always help either.  Still working on learning this camera but it would be easier if I had a written manual.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: btn1100
Reviews.Content: This surprising small super zoom will fit in your pocket and take great pictures in the right conditions.For a price that is now around 100.00, you will get fantastic colors and some great looking images.  The camera fits neatly into just about any pocket but has a reach of 350MM(35mm equivalent)The prosNice color and clarity in good light(some of the best eye candy color around)SmallGreat valueEasy to use10x zoomThe ConsImages get noisy past ISO 100Video is only 640x480All in all this super zoom / bridge class camera is priced like many standard point and shoots and is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: K. Kruse
Reviews.Content: The quit and dirty:What this camera does well:1. ZoomWhat this camera does not do well:1. Take pictures in bright light - the camera can't balance the light and dark portions of a frame.  I tried every setting and it just does not work. Part of the picture is over exposed and the other part is underexposed. Forget taking pictures on sunny days. This camera just can't handle sun.2. Take pictures in low light - the camera can't adjust the shutter speed and aperture in low light.  Unless you have a tripod ALL low light (including predusk) images will be blurry.3. Preserve batteries - This camera eats batteries like I have never seen. Two days max for heaving use.4. Take decent video - the video and sound quality are poor. While you can zoom in and out in video mode, the autofocus is so slow that zooming cause significant amounts of blurred video.If you still want to buy this camera after reading the four cons listed above, then you are not serious about photography.I took this camera on a 10 day trip to Europe and within the first two days, knew that I had wasted $150 on the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera needs viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Michael Ziaslas
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera.  Have had three Kodak cameras and loved the all.  This one had all the features I wanted except for a viewfinder.  Tried to use it in bright sunlight and found I could not frame effectively with only the view screen. Returned the camera.Kodak Easyshare Z915 10MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.5 inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera, Very Lame Software
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Alltone"
Reviews.Content: Other than the screen being completely washed out in sunlight, so you can't see what you are shooting, the camera works fine.  Nice picture quality, easy to use. I tend to shoot fully automatic, and I have no complaints and no bad shots.The software is a terror.  First, it's sub-par to any camera/editing/organizing software I've used, even the free program from Google. The organization / layout is truly terrible. And worse, you have to use the Kodak software to USB transfer.  The camera doesn't show up as a drive, so you are forced to default to the application - that means you are slaved to computers where the software is loaded.  I suppose you can hack it with the drivers, I haven't tried that yet.  In sum, just so they can get you to do business with Kodak on-line they've made this a camera-dependent on software system that's a routine frustration.  Junk, I guess that's one fo reasons for the great price, like a cheap printer and super-expensive ink. But, I digress...I'd buy it again, but when I get time I'm turning my attention towards reading this camera USB without the Kodak software, and it will get permanently deleted.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, nice photos, but cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Love to Boat"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an easy to use camera with a decent zoom that didn't cost over $200- this was the only camera I found- for the camera options the price is great.  It is easy to use (adjusts setting automatically) and takes a very nice looking picture.  But it not very sturdy- I wouldn't recommend hanging it from your wrist- it should go into a nice padded case when not in use.  If you are gentle with your cameras I recommend it, but if you bring it everywhere and like to put it in your pocket (it's a little big for that) I'd go with something else.  Buy the warranty for sure. I had to return mine, after a few days of use it stopped working correctly, maybe it was just a 'lemon', but I think it was because it is not sturdy.  It does go through batteries quicker than my last camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but NOT FOR MAC!
Reviews.Author: drwelch
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to preface by noting that the camera does take amazing photographs. For the price and the super plain exterior I was pleasantly surprised at how well it operates. However I just recently upgraded my Mac to OS 10.6.5 Snow Leapord and now the Easyshare software crashes before it even opens a window. iPhoto recognizes when videos are on the camera, but crashes when trying to import videos. No other software on my Mac recognizes that the camera is present. I cannot even get it to appear under "Devices" in Finder.If you have a Mac computer, you definitely need to consult the following list before purchasing a digital video camera. Unfortunately the iPhoto list of supported digital cameras has been removed from the Apple Support Site.[...]

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Bud8brian
Reviews.Content: We were buying a new computer so we decided to buy a new camera and video camera as well.  We had already owned two Kodak digital cameras and were very happy with both.  It seemed logical to purchase another one.  I am extrememly disappointed in this camera.  The other two we owned took great pictures, this one does not.  Do not buy this if you are hoping to take one picture and be done.  If you're looking to capture that one shot you will more than likely miss it with this camera.  I usually need at least 3 chances to take the picture I want.  Either it goes blurry, or the flash doesn't go off, or some other mishap occurs.  So if you plan to take wedding pics, graduation, etc. this is not the camera for you.  You will get home and be completely upset that most of your pictures look terrible.  Right now I am going to just look to sell it and recover some of my money and get something else.  But I do not want to rely on this camera with the holidays coming up.

Reviews.Title: Good value but lacks view finder
Reviews.Author: T. Fenner
Reviews.Content: Recently purchase this camera and, so far, am satistfied. Wish it had a view finder for important shots, when screen is difficult to see (i.e. outdoors) and to conserve power. (Screen displays are power hogs.)  Battery life is fair.  Given the camera's form factor a pack of 4 batteries and/or a view finder would have been better. Rechargable battery pack was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Sam S
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kodak camera, and it's a big improvement over the first one. I was really not impressed with the picture quality of the first camera so was hesitant to stay with Kodak. In my mind, what Kodak offers over its rivals is VALUE. I also thought it was important to keep my money in the Upstate New York economy (yes, everything is made in China now, but a small portion of the purchase returns to Rochester, however insignificant). I love the look and feel of this camera. It is a great size for a point-and-shoot, not so small that you can't hold onto it, but not so big that it becomes burdensome. It came with a great case, USB cable, and a charger for the pair of AA batteries. Controls are easy to use, with dedicated buttons for flash and situation settings. Having a 10x optical zoom was one of the major reasons I purchased this camera. You won't find that in competitors at a similar price. As far as picture quality goes, it is fine for what I need it for, an improvement over my last model, but still lags behind Canon. Megapixels are not the only important factor in crisp pictures. I think the Kodak sensors just tend to produce more grain, which higher megapixels can help. Overall though, for the price this is one solid product.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Linda S. Collins "ashleyyyy!"
Reviews.Content: Haven't learned to use all the features yet but, like  what I have learned.  Takes great pictures.  Downloads to the computer easily.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the Kodak Easy Share Z915. The pictures are clear. the zoom is also clear all the way out. It has allot of the features that much more expensive Camera have. Of course it's not a DSLR, But don't underestimate it, The Z915 is closer to a point & shoot Camera. Size is a little bet biger, It 4"W X 2.3/4"T X 1.1/4", Zoom extended it is 2.1/2" Thick. It has Movie,P,A,S,M,Scn,Sport,As. On the Internal Menu the Scn. It Has: Portrait, NightPortrait, Landscape, NightLandacape, Flower, Sunset, Back Light, CandleLight, Manor/Museum, Text,Beach, Snow,Fireworks, Children, SelfPortrait, Stage. And of course "Auto". I bought mine for $99.00 on Amazon. it could sell for allot more. I see Amazon has it now for $108.00 that is still a very good price. mine was on a one day special. Oh yes do buy Lithium Batteries, They last a long time. They are worth the extra money. If I can figure out how to add Photos to this I will.Specs: EasyShare Z91510 Megapixel CCD10X Optical zoom lensOptical image stabilization2.5" LCD displaySmart Capture (auto scene selection) modeSD/SDHC card slot (plus onboard memory, I'd imagine)Uses AA batteriesComes in red,blue,black,and gray.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Lucky Strega "Lucky Strega"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the camera. It does what i want in a camera for taking family, outdoor and other types of photos.

Reviews.Title: Pretty great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Jones
Reviews.Content: It's not sleek and stylish, in fact it looks a lot like my grandpa's 35 mm camera which has been in use since the '80's.  So if that's important to you, get a Nikon coolpix instead.  I own a DSLR camera and was looking for an inexpensive point and shoot to take on excursions where I don't want to take a $600 camera.  It's not perfect and you can't expect miracles from a $99 camera, however its does take beautiful outdoor shots and good indoor photos with a flash.  I do find a lot of noise on indoor pictures but am able to reduce it considerably with photo viewing software that is on my computer. If you like to have options and not just use "auto" mode, this camera provides that.  I was very impressed with how easy it is to use without ever cracking open the owner's manual.

Reviews.Title: Worth The Money
Reviews.Author: L. Pascual "eewoll"
Reviews.Content: I like the camera because of the construction quality, the ease of use,the clarity of most of the pictures, a few tends to be blurry for reason I don't know.  And it has a fast shutter speed especially when you turn off the view pics everytime you take a picture, really fast.Overall I gave it a 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Five Stars!
Reviews.Author: Suzanna Foote
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera.  The pictures are great, the movies are just as great.  There are many settings to use to get just what you want.  It is easy to use.  If a person doesn't want to use the various settings and choices, the Smart Capture feature works very well.  I have been taking digital pictures for many years and this is my 4th digital camera.  The camera has not let me down on any of the many pictures and movies I have shot with it.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Eraleta Colson
Reviews.Content: we have no clue what we are doing...but this product was easy to use and the guide was also easy to read...it was short and to the point..i am glad we spend out money on it....cant wait to make tons of memories...

Reviews.Title: Can't Complain
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: MY WIFE IS HAPPY AND LOVES IT, NEED I SAY MORE!!!!!! and only for $99, great deal!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Buzzyboy
Reviews.Content: I was a tad bit skeptical because though most people had rated this camera highly, there were a few that felt the camera was a disaster. I now belong to the former, holding this camera in high regard. This is my fourth digital camera (I presently have 3) and because of the flexibility of the 10X zoom, it's my favorite. I've already experimented with it in a variety of different settings and it's performed admirably. The stabilization system is superb, the optics are bright and crisp and it handles wonderfully. It fits the hand like a glove and I'm totally impressed. I, like others, would prefer that it fit in a Kodak base for downloading and charging purposes but it's still a wonderful deal. The thing that finally made me leap into this was the fact that Staples is selling this for $99.95 this week. How is it possible to pass over this camera at that price! I really recommend this camera highly!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Pulkit
Reviews.Content: I own panasonic zs3 and this one. I have to say that panasonic zs3 is much better than this one in all the aspects. However, this one is not bad. It takes very good pictures. Zoom is wonderful. Video quality is also good. You can zoom while taking video. It is also quite fast. It was less than half of the price of panasonic zs3. I am very satisfied with the purchase. I'll very much recommend this to others. I bought it for $90 and it is an awesome camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: The Bibliophile
Reviews.Content: As my title says, this is a great camera for the price.  It has many options for photo taking and takes great pics.  Everybody who sees my photos raves about how crisp and clear they are, even when zoomed way in, using the optical zoom.  However, I don't care for the additional digital zoom - it makes the pics look very grainy - so I use it as little as possible.  I bought my first one a few months ago for less than $120, a real bargain at the time, and just bought my second for less than $90.  An amazing bargain.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - Great price
Reviews.Author: Alex Weibel
Reviews.Content: Not a DSLR, but capable of capturing very good pictures. I believe that photography is 1/3 knowledge of your equipment (working within its limitations), 1/3 lighting and 1/3 composition. I am still working on the first and this camera makes it easier.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Smith "Not beginner"
Reviews.Content: just started using it, but it does everything I want it to. The 3 picture panorama is unbelievable. Great price.

Reviews.Title: Great but no battery life
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Blue "crazy camera lady"
Reviews.Content: The camera seenmed great but the battery died my first vacation and I had it less then a month.

Reviews.Title: Crummy indoor photos
Reviews.Author: D. Gilford "picky shopper"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple weeks now. I've tried different settings with no luck. All the indoor photos have a lot of noise, are unfocused, and look pixelated along the edges of bright colors. I've owned two other digital cameras and never had this problem (other brands besides Kodak). I chose this camera because all reviews said it's quick recovery between photos and that's true. Just don't take indoor photos. Outdoor photos seem better but still any lines look pixelated and distorted. I wouldn't say outdoor photos are fuzzy - they're quite sharp. But almost too sharp when lines or words are in the photos.I think part of the problem is that the flash is not bright enough so the camera compensates by putting noise into it. These were taken on normal exposure and on the point and shoot setting. On other settings or on close-ups the noise wasn't quite as noticable, but focus tended to be an issue if the room was somewhat dark. I was disappointed there was no way to adjust the flash brightness like on a Canon P&S; I used to own.The other thing I noticed is the barrel effect. I took some photos down a narrow hallway with this camera and my very old Sony Cybershot. This camera really made the walls bend! The other camera had only a very faint bend.I cannot recommend this camera unless you're ONLY using it for outdoor photos. I will say that all the other features were easy to use and simple to learn.

Reviews.Title: Terrible documentation
Reviews.Author: D. Wilson
Reviews.Content: You definately have to download & print the online manual BUT even it is terrible.Very few of the features in the index are on the pages it states. Even a simple thing like how to remove the optional memory card is never given. Yea you push down on to make it pop up but why leave this simple thing out?. Want to change the resolution for a web page? It's called picture size. Resolution never mentioned. And if you submit pictures over the web, the lowest resolution available is 1280x960, bigger than some sites allow. One I submit to has a max of 350kb so I have to use my old HP with its 640x480 resolution which defeats my reason for buying the Z915.

Reviews.Title: Awesome But.......
Reviews.Author: M. Smith "S"
Reviews.Content: Wow,I was going to buy another camera but the deal ended The camera is very light but it is a little cheap the camera takes great pictures The flash is To bright The software is not that good but the camera is great but i suggest to buy it! The usb cable dosen't work. You Should buy it bot there is a lot of cons but the camera rocks

Reviews.Title: Horrible.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "ME :)"
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for myself becuase my camera broke and I have two kids that I can't stand not taking pictures of. It worked for less than a day. I was going to return it but I was unable to get to the post office in time to have it back by the specific return date. So here it sits in a box not getting any use. Huge waste of $100.00 :( Sadly Amazon is not useful when it comes to customer Service.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: mad as hell "at morons"
Reviews.Content: thank you for all the emails and quick response regarding the camera, will buy from you again.... thank you karryn ivory

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift.
Reviews.Author: Southern gal
Reviews.Content: I'll have to wait for my son to rate this camera.  I bought it for him at his request, and he has to review it's attributes

Reviews.Title: Arrived broken
Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: I received this as a Christmas present and have used it twice. I noticed that when viewing the pictures on the LCD, the view wasn't very good.  You really could not tell if the picture turned out good or not.  Unless you plugged it into a computer to view them on a full screen.  For the most part, they were okay but again, you could not tell unless you loaded them.  Kind of takes away from one of the huge benefits of digital...being able to tell if you need to retake or not.  I figured that may be a setting issue and continued to use it through the holidays. We took a few short video clips as we used that feature extensively on our last camera (Canon). We took four and ALL FOUR of them were fuzzy, bad quality. So I called Kodak to see if I could get some help in settings changed. He told me I needed to send it in for repairs as the LCD screen was obviously bad. So let's recap: I've had the camera a total of four days, have used it twice and it ALREADY NEEDS REPAIR. You're kidding me.  I'm getting ready to have a baby and now I'm without a camera. Even if they could get it repaired quickly, I wouldn't dare trust this to potentially miss precious moments with the birth of my daughter.  So my advice, don't bother.  It's junk.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Julie Mills
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kodak Z915 at the end of August 2010, took 200 pictures at the zoo with this camera then could not transfer the pictures from the camera to the computer.  I had to send the camera back for repair.  Kodak had a quick turn around time and I had the camera back in 2 weeks.  This is not my only camera so I had to use my other camera while this one was being repaired.This camera goes through batteries very quickly.  When going to the zoo and I took 200 pictures, I went through 6 AA batteries.  I turn the camera off when I am not using it so this seems excessive.The camera takes good pictures and the zoom is quick to focus.  It is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare
Reviews.Author: Jaycoub "Jaycoub"
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a great purchase. I am a little disappointed in the product. I am a huge Nikon SLR user and carrying that stuff all the time gets a little tedious and to also mention that most live Venues will now not allow you to take a "professional" style camera into the show to take pictures. I was looking online for a great deal and Amazon has this on sale for a low cost and I thought it would be worth it. Some pictures turn out fantastic and others really makes the focal point on the camera seem like crap. I should have coughed up the extra dough for a Nikon standard digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, GOD AWFUL software.
Reviews.Author: Moises Jose Zet
Reviews.Content: This is gonna be short and simple. The Camera is great, takes wonderful picture, decent video and has a ton of modes for every picture scenario possible. But getting those precious moments out of your camera with the included software is a pain in the A$$ unless you buy a docking station. Word of advice if you want a nice camera look no further than this for the price, but invest in a media card reader that way all you have to do is pop out the card use the media card reader to transfer your pics and vids. It will be a lot faster and whole less stressful.Camera 5 starsSoftware that forced upon you by kodak 1 star.

Reviews.Title: Not great quality!
Reviews.Author: katsapp "katsapp"
Reviews.Content: Camera broke! Memory card pops out so battery door will not close! Used less than a month!

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures...Video Sound Quality Sucks
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. Even the video quality is pretty cool. But the sound on the video is VERY low.Even with the sound settings on high. At first I thought it was just the camera so I uploaded the video to my computer. The sound was still very low. I sent the camera back and received my refund quickly which was awesome. This is a good camera if you don't plan on using it to shoot videos.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality camera
Reviews.Author: Hector Quiteno
Reviews.Content: My first digital still camera was a 2mb Kodak and I swear it was better than this one. Quality of pictures in this camera is awful, despite the 10mb sensor. I compare it with my Sony Cybershot DSC-H20 and it's a world of difference (i'm buying a DSLR and will stil keep the H20, my whole family loves it). Even my 6mb Samsung point and shot takes better photos. Pictures cannot be read in your PC without installing the whole Easyshare software, which I did not do because it makes conflict with alternate picture software that I prefer. Your LCD TV via USB port won't read it while connected with the kodak USB cable. This problem does not exist with my Sony and Samsung. But the worst problem is that every memory card ever used in the camera can never be read in any other place. It's like the camera formats the card, so the only way to read the pictures is via the Kodak cable and having installed the whole Easyshare. It makes me feel like I'm a slave to Kodak. I wrote to Kodak support and they sent me a guide to read the photos in the PC using Windows Imaging Acquisition (WIA) driver. It's a 15 steps techie guide that I will not apply. Conclusion: don't buy this camera, you will loose. I plan to give it away or sent it to the trash, as I cannot sell something with these problems.

Reviews.Title: DOA - Should have been a clue
Reviews.Author: C. Valine Stapleton "Okiebooksnmore"
Reviews.Content: When I recieved this it was DOA - Dead on arrival.I DID NOT order it from Amazon. (maybe I should have ) I should have realized then to send it back. They did fix it for free. Now however it had only been a year and it is messing up again. The lens not opeaning all the way or not closing all the way.. And at tims the pictures are fuzzy. I've had 3-4 kodak camera and they used to be good. this one isn't made too well. It  is really light weight amd when I first held it, I thought it felt flimsy. and very breakable. I will be getting a diff brand next time.

Reviews.Title: Defective Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Pardes "SeaGypsy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as an Amazon Deal of the Day for $99. I bought it to replace an older Kodak Z series camera. I put the camera to the test - took wide angle photos, zoom, video, macro, low-light - flowers and dogs (my newly adopted southern belle - Tara). At first the camera took great pictures. I liked the rechargeable batteries interchangeable with regular batteries. Nice photos- good video - good image stabilization. The rechargeable battery drained within a day - which didn't seem odd since I was using the initial charge they came with. The next session I took outside photos of flowers using various manual & preset settings. They were okay but not great. Some were out of focus, poor light metering or shutter speed. Again the battery drained after this session. At this point I switched to brand new Rayovac AA batteries.  Today an assortment of photos and again the photos were not great and the batteries drained very quickly.  After the 1st camera use I noticed a faint 'electronic burning smell'. This odor got worse everytime I used the camera.At this point I was concerned the camera was defective so I started the return process. I wasn't sure whether it was defective or just a bad camera until I packed the camera a week later. A white powder substance coated the battery area - inside and outside. This white powder was not there when I last used the camera and I had taken out the batteries after the last use.I choose a refund vs exchange since I didn't want to chance another defective camera.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera, batteries run out too quickly!
Reviews.Author: photomama13 "photomama13"
Reviews.Content: After having this camera for only a couple of months it stopped working correctly.  The flash only works about half of the time and when it does it makes the picture way too bright.  It also is really slow at taking the pictures now.  It takes good pictures outside in the bright light but is HORRIBLE at taking pictures inside.  I very rarely even use it anymore.  Very disappointed.  It also eats up batteries.  I can only take about 40 pictures before having to change the batteries.This camera is fantastic!  It takes really nice pictures and is really easy to use.  I love the 10x zoom feature and the camera is not really that big to have this much zoom.  I don't like the lag showing the picture to the lcd and you have to hit the capture button again to get the previous picture to go away to see what you are taking the next picture of since there is no view finder.  I haven't had a problem seeing the lcd in the bright sun like some other people said in their reviews.  The digital camera batteries that the camera came with (kodak brand) lasted for about 250 pictures zooming and taking movies and everything, but the rechargeable batteries that it came with only lasted about 75 pictures.  I am not sure why that is, you would think that the rechargeables would last longer.  So I would suggest if you don't want to carry around extra batteries that you purchase the kodak digital camera batteries.  I have been really impressed by this camera especially for the price I paid.  It does way more than a lot of cameras in the same price range.  I would highly recommend this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Lens cover
Reviews.Author: kbs
Reviews.Content: Nice camera except after the first month the lens cover already hangs up when closing.

Reviews.Title: Needs more features found standard in competitors
Reviews.Author: RLSd
