Reviews.Content: For a camera that offers PASM manual modes, it also needs manual focus for macro shooting, and pre-focusing on an area to capture fast action (like a skateboarder coming in and out of frame quickly). Also needed are custom white balance, variable JPG compression levels. and manual flash levels to optically trigger off-camera flashes. Kodak makes good value cameras, but it's these minor features that are lacking and come standard in competitors cameras that break the deal for me.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE!
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: This seems like a great deal: 10x zoom 10 megapixel camera for under $100; however the picture quality is awful.  All pictures (not just those where zoom was used) were very fuzzy.  Returning after reviewing pictures.

Reviews.Title: z915
Reviews.Author: benkmat
Reviews.Content: quality camera, but don't forget to buy tons of batteries, if you planning to use flash.

Reviews.Title: Affordable but not great
Reviews.Author: A. W. Hunt "Andiof the Hunt"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak EasyShare Z915 Digital camera is not top of the line, but neither is it's price.  I bought one for my grand-daughter to try out.  She's had a good time with it, but the picture quality isn't the greatest.  I tried it out myself last weekend to see if she was moving when she took pictures, but the quality was the same.  I prefer my single-lens reflex camera, but I have to admit that this is a lot lighter.  For the price of the camera, it's ok.

Reviews.Title: Usually Kodak's are good, but...
Reviews.Author: Rose Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I have an older Kodak camera and it still works great.  So even tho this new one was not ok, still have faith in Kodak.  But on this one the zoom was grainy and dark..maybe I just got a bad one. I got a speedy refund from Amazon.  Thanks, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: this sucks
Reviews.Author: MisterPeter
Reviews.Content: I had a Kodak DX4330 3.1MP camera before this...took great pics, but it got stolen.  anyway, went to a company BBQ today to give this a test as i only got it a week ago.  i put it on the "general setting" didn't want to get into anything heavy as i also gave it to other people to walk around and take pics.  the pictures were horrible...half of them i couldn't even use...I'm thinking if you want a camera that needs TLC...that each photo has to be fine tuned by putting in the correct settings...hold steady...watch your focus, this might be your camera.  but, if you just want clear clean shots...no matter who is taking the pictures, go back with the DX4330.  I'm going to buy another..the pics were great.  I am VERY disappointed and actually embarrassed about this as I'm supposed to be sending out pics to all the employees of our BBQ.  sorry Kodak, just make a great point and shoot that does a great job of focusing. the 3 pictures i had of other people taking pictures of me were unbelievably out of focus. i can't even use them.  glad i paid only 90 bucks....what a waste even at that price.

Reviews.Title: Cannot get the pictures off the camera...
Reviews.Author: Yours Truly
Reviews.Content: Kodak is the only camera manufacturer I've seen so far who require to install their piece of junk software to get pictures off their cameras. And as easy as XP is with installing most software I cannot get this poj to work. My pictures are locked up in the camera unless I buy a sdcard reader. I have different computers and different laptops, personal and business. So am I supposed to go through this aggravation for each install, even if I can get this to somehow work?The installer gives me the agreement several times and keeps jolting the Explorer throughout the install. In the install options I chose not to install their Easy Share crap but the Easy Share install bar showed up anyways. After 6-7 minutes of install and a reboot I connect the camera cable. XP sees the camera but then nothing. Tried several times without luck. Tells me Kodak got their poj software programmed on the cheap, perhaps in India or somewhere.Kodak you can send this camera to India too. Its coming right back...

Reviews.Title: POOR QUALITY
Reviews.Author: D. Combs
Reviews.Content: Bought the Z915 for vacation in Mexico. It lasted 5 days and then the screen turned white and I couldn't review or take any photos. Normal use of the camera, no banging it around or dropping it. Just don't think the Quality is there.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z915 10MP quit almost immediately
Reviews.Author: Steel Pipe
Reviews.Content: The second day into a 12 day Mediterranean Cruise the camera simple failed to activate when the on/off button was pushed.  I changed batteries twice to no avail. I bought a new camera on the ship.  I am going to try to return the camera.  We will see how that works out.

Reviews.Title: Kodak
Reviews.Author: Kadi
Reviews.Content: Could not get the green out of eyes with the flash on. Even tho the camera has several settings to get the red out of eyes which didn't seem to do much the eyes were green.. I took it to a hocky game and when I used the full zoom most of the pictures were blurry. Then before the night was over after taking about 20 pictures through out the night the battery went dead and turned it off.  Really!?!  I am working on now trying to send it back. We will see how that goes.

Reviews.Title: Not a point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Janice Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace and old Easy Share and to take on a trip to Ireland.  I really like all aspects, except for the fact that you can't just hand it to someone to snap a good picture of you.  You must push the button half-way and get the green focus frame to get a sharp picture.  Most of the shots made by someone else were blurry, so we have very few good pictures of my husband and myself.  My old camera was not as sensitive.  However, when done properly, it makes good pictures.  I am not a camera expert, but the one's I made were very good.

Reviews.Title: Loved it while it worked
Reviews.Author: HJG
Reviews.Content: This camera took great, clear photos.  The 10x zoom was fantastic.  It had a  lot of features that were worth while to use.  Unfortunately I only had the camera for 3 weeks when I stumbled while out hiking.  The camera hit soft dirt about 3 inches from the ground and the LED broke.If it had taken a hard fall I would pay to have it fixed, but since it broke so easily I'm going to toss it.My next camera will have a view finder.

Reviews.Title: good camera, but broke after 3 months
Reviews.Author: John "john"
Reviews.Content: I bought a cannon that did not work, so I tried this one,as my previous kodak was good.  took good pictures, but was a little slow, which is common with the high zoom cameras.  broke after 3 months, and returned for a new one, which I hope will last.

Reviews.Title: I don't recommend the kodak Z915 camera,
Reviews.Author: J. Hatfield "Hobby photographer"
Reviews.Content: If you are going to take most of your pictures outside in daylight, you may be happy with this camera. Unfortunatly, the indoor pictures are very poor quality. If the flash is always used indoors, the pictures may be too bright and washed out. If the subject is far enough away, the pictures are OK but not good. If the flash isn't used because of sufficient lighting, the pictures are blurry and fuzzy. They do not pick up detail and you'll wish you bought another brand. Kodak should be ashamed of themselves for putting this camera on the market. I've owned (and still own) an older, cheaper Kodak that does a much better job of taking good quality pictures indoors than this newer, slightly more expensive camera. I wish I'd had not bought the Z915. When the batteries run down on this Z915 camera, I'll simply sell it on eBay as a used camera, complete with all original boxes, packing and instructions. It's a real disappointment. No more Kodaks for me. I'll buy a more expensive Canon for it's replacement. I've been a hobby photographer for 30 years and this is the worst camera I've ever owned. I'm really disappointed in it's picture quality. And, no, it's not that I just got a bad camera. A friend got a Z915 at the same time as I bought mine. Her camera performance is just as bad as mine. She now wants a Canon, too. We both just laugh when we see each other's picures taken with the Z915. It's as bad as a kid's toy camera. Even outdoors in bright sunlight, never use the zoom feature unless the camera is on a tripod. You can't hold the camera still enough to take a picture that isn't blurry. We've tried many different settings and nothing seems to work well enough to get a great, clear, sharp picture. My recommendation is stay away from the Kodak Z915! Even at bargain basement, sale prices. It just isn't worth it and you won't be happy with the results!

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk!!
Reviews.Author: Monique1
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review with the information that a few years ago I received a Kodak camera as a Christmas Gift.  It is a Z712 IS.  Very nice camera.  A few weeks after I got it, it stopped turning on.  Or to be more precise, it turned on and then immediately turned off.  While going through the warranty 'service' of Kodak's "Help Center", I found I had to pay to ship the camera to Illinios for it to be repaired.  I was not pleased that their obviously faulty camera was now costing me money to have repaired.  I was shocked that there was no 'repair center' closer than Illinios as I live in New Hampshire.  After a very unsatisfying discussion with their customer service department I was basically told it was to bad and if I wanted the camera fixed I would have to ship it.  I did so.  It was returned several weeks later and it came out of the box doing the same thing I sent it in to have repaired the first time.  I called "Customer Service" again, this time quite angry and expressed that I wanted a replacement camera sent to me.  I was told that the best they could do for me was to send me by email and pre-paid shipping label and I would need to re-ship it to Illinios for repair, again.  I did so, it came back with a note saying that there was nothing wrong with it and to use the correct batteries.  I was and had been using a battery that was suggested in the user's manual yet this time it worked. (This camera was not bought through Amazon.)Fast forward to Sept. 2010.  My daughter's 16th birthday was coming up and she had shown a lot of interest in photography, even going so far as to join an extracurricular photography club at school.  I spent considerable time reviewing cameras and the Z915 had some wonderful reviews yet I was hesitant to try them again.  I finally decided I would as it seemed to have the best 'layout' for the money.  Camera arrived.  Daughter's birthday arrived.  Camera turns on and then immediately shuts off when she tries to use it.  We charge the rechargable batteries with the recharger that came in the bundle with the camera.  Tried again, camera turned on and off.  Put the batteries in another camera, that camera ran fine on the batteries.  Called Kodak and was told that I would have to pay to ship the camera.  I finally lost my patience and demanded that they replace the camera with a NEW one at their cost.  One camera is a fluke, two-with the exact same problem is shoddy quality control.  Especially when one of the automated options on the menu was to hit #1 if your camera would not turn on.  That tells me its a regular problem.I was put on hold for 15 minutes or so and was informed by the woman 'assisting' me that they would send me a pre-paid shipping label so that I could have the camera repaired, in Illinios still apparently.  I informed them to keep their label, I would return the camera for a refund.  NEVER again will I purchase a Kodak product, not even their prints.The camera may well take wonderful pictures but if it won't turn on it doesn't much matter.  So my daughter is out a present for her 16th birthday and I have to figure out a way to buy her a new one while waiting for the refund to come through. (Amazon's help center only gave me the option of a refund as they no longer stock this particular product.)

Reviews.Title: Regular
Reviews.Author: R. Reyes
Reviews.Content: It is good for the price, but the image on the screen is not very good, menus are half complicated. The belt breaks easily.Está buena por el precio, pero la imagen en la pantalla no es muy buena, los menúes son medio complicados. La correita de agarrarla se le parte fácil.

Reviews.Title: not completely satisfied
Reviews.Author: VAMMICHIGAN "ring lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my all in one Kodak camera because my printer dock stopped working and I had no way of printing out my pictures at home any more.  I read the reviews and thought this camera would be good for stills and video.  My son is in a band and I like to video his gigs and burn them to DVD, however, the batteries ran down very quickly and I couldn't get the video to burn.  The camera is much heavier than my old one and so far I don't think the pictures are better quality.

Reviews.Title: picture quality
Reviews.Author: T. C. Besancon
Reviews.Content: The package for sale was good price, but the camera itself was defected.  That is shown too much tiny pixles when taking pictures which made the screen unclear.  I tested this camera from store, it did not have this problem.

Reviews.Title: My easy share
Reviews.Author: Robert Swain
Reviews.Content: This is a decent camera I think the construction is on the cheap side though. I havent learned all the functions as of yet but the price was right on this product

Reviews.Title: poor quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Mara
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm very desapointed with KODAK Z915 photo actually worse than my 4 year old Sansung Digimax 5MP. the video totally useless...I decided to return this camera(-20%) and try the Canon SD970.  The ~$$$$ is absurd for the poor quality that you get.

Reviews.Title: Piece of *&&@##*(#@&*(
Reviews.Author: Debbie S. Davis
Reviews.Content: Buy a different camera.  It takes great pics.  Unfortunately it is difficult to get them onto your computer after that.  The onboard memory is not easily accessible and it has corrupted two memory cards.  I can't stand this thing and ended up getting a Nikon to replace it.

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera Purchase
Reviews.Author: Bonni Gilley
Reviews.Content: This camera worked for 1 week then quit. Stupidly I threw away the packaging and was unable to return it. I will never buy a Kodak camera again nor will I ever purchase a camea from this vendor.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z915 camera
Reviews.Author: Yendis8970
Reviews.Content: The camera itself works good.  The problem is it eats batteries and there it has no charger with it. I have looked and looked for one but cannot locate one. At least Kodak could make and supply the customer with a charger.  There are great chargers for other Kodak camreas for other cameras where you just sit the camera on the charger. But not one for this camera. At least there should be one available as an add on feature at additional price.  This changing batteries every couple days with heavy usage or every week is for the birds. Even with light usage this camera requires 2 new batteries a week. Also, I tried to return it but guess what? Amazon could find no record of my purchase and has only responded with an agnowledgement of one at this late day of one month (8/24/2010 )and only with the option of a review!

Reviews.Title: Pour point and shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: James Cody "Ydoc"
Reviews.Content: I bought this after reading the reviews and return it. The 10 MP didn't work. Indoors it had a delay between pushing the shot button and actual shutter opening. I have a 6 yr. old grandaughter and lost a lot of good shots. I have a 5 MP Konica Minolta that takes much better pictures. The flash is okay. I bought the camera in hopes that it would be a good and point camera. I like the fact that you can use 2 ea. AA batteries. We have 2 Kodak cameras at work that are 2-3 years old 3MP & 4MP and they take better pics that the Z915. This is the worst camera that I have every had.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z915 10MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Wayne Cole "hinbww"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare Z915 10MP Digital Camera is great but if you buy one make sure you check out the Batteries because the ones I got were bad.  If like me if the camera does not work take it to Wal-Mart and have them check it. They found out the batteries were no good. After I got new batteries the camera worked fine.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Gary J. Bipes "write me"
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A NICE CAMERA , I JUST SAW THE UPGRADE MODEL, AT SAMS FOR THE PRICE OF 200.00 AND IT WAS A 12 MEG, i LIKE THIS ONE . ONLY THING IS YOU HAVE TO MAKE SURE AND HOLD THE BUTTON FOR A SEC, TO FOCUS. I GOT CAUGHT SHOOTING AND NOT HAVE IT IN FOCUS. LEARNING TO CK THE GREEN BOX FIRST. LITTLE BIT FRUSTRATING. i MAY HAVE TO LOOK AT THE BOOK. ALSO THE NEW MODEL HAS A LARGER SCREEN FOR VIEWING. AND 12 MEG LIKE I SAID. I may have to try amazon and see if they have a referb model. I think I would have got that one . always somethig better after you pick one up . That is progress, for the price amazon sells , just go and watch for the next model , they seem to have the best price, got to E bay and play but YOU can order for the best price right on amazon, and not spend time bidding. Can't really beat AMAZON . they do the best. I don't even look at  E BAY much any more.OH i do aerial phot work withthe kodak. I am a somewhat pro photographer ,. I did army NAM combat photo, I carry the kodak on my belt so it is with me all the time. and it does good work. I have 3  flat cameras also. but the Kodak looked nice. thanks

Reviews.Title: Camera Didn't Work
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Shutterbug"
Reviews.Content: Ordered the camera through J&R; Music World. Camera would not turn on. Bought new batteries; still wouldn't turn on. Called and talked to India guy from the Kodak site. He told me to take out the batteries and clean them off. That didn't help. He gave me the address to mail in the camera to have it fixed. I mailed it 2 weeks ago and haven't heard anything. I'm sure the camera would take good pictures if it just turned on.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Tony Monzo
Reviews.Content: This camera had great reviews. I sent it back the same day I received it. Zoom would not focus. Picture quality was terrible. This is a toy. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: never worked
Reviews.Author: susan
Reviews.Content: bought this on a gold box special - arrived - could not get the menu to set the data and time let alone take any pictures - contacted kodak - what a joke - they finally decided defective - am returning it to amazon and not happy - total waste of time and money

10-megapixel resolution for photo-quality prints up to 30 x 40 inches

Kit includes custom-fit camera case, travel charger, and 2 Kodak AA rechargeable batteries
